Article Title: Laurent de Brunhoff, ‘Babar the Elephant’ author, dies aged 98
Sentence:
CNN —

Writer and illustrator Laurent de Brunhoff, who continued his father’s legacy by producing dozens of original books for his “Babar the Elephant” series, has died aged 98.

Article Title: Laurent de Brunhoff, ‘Babar the Elephant’ author, dies aged 98
Sentence: De Brunhoff died at his home in Key West, Florida on Friday following a recent stroke, his wife, the critic and author Phyllis Rose, told CNN via email.

Article Title: Laurent de Brunhoff, ‘Babar the Elephant’ author, dies aged 98
Sentence: A citizen of both France and the US, de Brunhoff published more than 40 books featuring Babar, an impeccably well-dressed elephant dreamed up by his mother, Cécile, and brought to life by his illustrator father, Jean, in the 1930s.

Article Title: Laurent de Brunhoff, ‘Babar the Elephant’ author, dies aged 98
Sentence: “The start — (the) very start of Babar — was a bed(time) story from my mother,” de Brunhoff told CNN in an interview, aired in 2003.

Article Title: Laurent de Brunhoff, ‘Babar the Elephant’ author, dies aged 98
Sentence: “And my brother and I loved the story.

Article Title: Laurent de Brunhoff, ‘Babar the Elephant’ author, dies aged 98
Sentence: We went to my father’s studio and told him about it.

Article Title: Laurent de Brunhoff, ‘Babar the Elephant’ author, dies aged 98
Sentence: He started to make a book for us.

Article Title: Laurent de Brunhoff, ‘Babar the Elephant’ author, dies aged 98
Sentence: After the first book he made another one and another one.

Article Title: Laurent de Brunhoff, ‘Babar the Elephant’ author, dies aged 98
Sentence:
And he just discovered himself, I think.”

De Brunhoff was just 12 when his father died of tuberculosis, in 1937, having published five books for the series.

Article Title: Laurent de Brunhoff, ‘Babar the Elephant’ author, dies aged 98
Sentence: These early titles see the green-suited Babar leave the jungle for Paris when his mother is shot by a hunter, before embarking on various adventures and being crowned king of the elephants.

Article Title: Laurent de Brunhoff, ‘Babar the Elephant’ author, dies aged 98
Sentence: A further two of his father’s books were published posthumously — and a then-teenage de Brunhoff colored and designed a cover illustration for the seventh and last of his Babar titles.

Article Title: Laurent de Brunhoff, ‘Babar the Elephant’ author, dies aged 98
Sentence: Sharing his father’s gift for illustration, de Brunhoff studied at the Académie de la Grande Chaumière art school in the French capital and worked as an abstract painter.

Article Title: Laurent de Brunhoff, ‘Babar the Elephant’ author, dies aged 98
Sentence: In 1946, at the age of 21, he revived Babar with the first of his own books, “Babar’s Cousin: That Rascal Arthur.”

Article Title: Laurent de Brunhoff, ‘Babar the Elephant’ author, dies aged 98
Sentence: “I wanted Babar to live again,” he told CNN in 2003.

Article Title: Laurent de Brunhoff, ‘Babar the Elephant’ author, dies aged 98
Sentence:
Global phenomenon

In the decades after his father’s death, de Brunhoff introduced new characters and storylines, helping popularize the series and bring it to a global audience.

Article Title: Laurent de Brunhoff, ‘Babar the Elephant’ author, dies aged 98
Sentence: His original tales saw Babar traveling around the world with his family, learning how to cook, taking up yoga and even visiting an alien planet.

Article Title: Laurent de Brunhoff, ‘Babar the Elephant’ author, dies aged 98
Sentence: His most recent book for the series, “Babar’s Guide to Paris,” was published in 2017, more than 70 years after he first revived the character.

Article Title: Laurent de Brunhoff, ‘Babar the Elephant’ author, dies aged 98
Sentence: Children's author and illustrator Laurent de Brunhoff working at his home during a BBC television interview in 1969.

Article Title: Laurent de Brunhoff, ‘Babar the Elephant’ author, dies aged 98
Sentence:
Malcolm Winton/Radio Times/Getty Images

Despite capturing the imagination of generations of children, the series has been accused of being an allegory of — and justification for — French colonialism.

Article Title: Laurent de Brunhoff, ‘Babar the Elephant’ author, dies aged 98
Sentence: Some of Jean de Brunhoff’s original illustrations and storylines have meanwhile been criticized for employing racist stereotypes.

Article Title: Laurent de Brunhoff, ‘Babar the Elephant’ author, dies aged 98
Sentence:
In the 1980s, Chilean author Ariel Dorfman argued that Babar’s story — including his adoption of human clothes and mannerisms, and the subsequent depictions of him bringing the benefits of human civilization back to the jungle — represented the “fulfillment of the dominant countries’ colonial dream.”

“Babar slips progress into the jungle without upsetting the ecological balance, because (Jean) de Brunhoff omits all the plundering, racism, underdevelopment and misery from his story of the relationship between the two worlds,” Dorfman wrote in his 1983 book, “The Empire’s Old Clothes: What the Lone Ranger, Babar, and Other Innocent Heroes Do to Our Minds.”

Article Title: Laurent de Brunhoff, ‘Babar the Elephant’ author, dies aged 98
Sentence: When asked about Dorfman’s critique by National Geographic in 2014, de Brunhoff appeared to accept the idea that the series perpetuated myths about French colonialism.

Article Title: Paris waiters compete in race to get a coffee and croissant across the capital
Sentence:
Paris CNN —

The army of waiters who are the lifeblood of the French capital’s many cafés often get a bad rap, accused of everything from being unable to crack a smile to being downright rude and impatient to their customers.

Article Title: Paris waiters compete in race to get a coffee and croissant across the capital
Sentence: But the “garçons de café” of Paris are undoubtedly professionals.

Article Title: Paris waiters compete in race to get a coffee and croissant across the capital
Sentence: They can remember the orders of eight people without taking notes.

Article Title: Paris waiters compete in race to get a coffee and croissant across the capital
Sentence: They can carry all the dishes and drinks in one go.

Article Title: Paris waiters compete in race to get a coffee and croissant across the capital
Sentence: And they can manage a busy lunch rush without breaking a sweat – and still find time for a quick cigarette break.

Article Title: Paris waiters compete in race to get a coffee and croissant across the capital
Sentence: Those professional skills (minus the smoking) were on display in full force on Sunday when Paris staged the Course des Cafés, marking the revival of a once-annual event that challenges waiters to race a two-kilometer route (1.2 miles) while carrying a tray laden with a cup of coffee, a glass of water and a croissant.

Article Title: Paris waiters compete in race to get a coffee and croissant across the capital
Sentence: Two hundred of the crème de la crème of the city’s cafes, classically attired in black pants or skirt, apron and a white top, took to the streets and alleys of central Paris to compete in the event and entertain the crowds.

Article Title: Paris waiters compete in race to get a coffee and croissant across the capital
Sentence: To win the race, participants not only needed to be quick but also careful.

Article Title: Paris waiters compete in race to get a coffee and croissant across the capital
Sentence: Any change to the composition of their tray would impact their final score.

Article Title: Paris waiters compete in race to get a coffee and croissant across the capital
Sentence: Absolutely no spillage was permitted.

Article Title: Paris waiters compete in race to get a coffee and croissant across the capital
Sentence: And, as the Paris city government jokingly pointed out, no eating either!

Article Title: Paris waiters compete in race to get a coffee and croissant across the capital
Sentence: The strict requirements meant the event was less of a run and more of a speed walk.

Article Title: Paris waiters compete in race to get a coffee and croissant across the capital
Sentence: “I tried holding the tray, it’s pretty heavy!”

Article Title: Paris waiters compete in race to get a coffee and croissant across the capital
Sentence: Paris Mayor Anne Hidalgo told journalists shortly before the race started.

Article Title: Paris waiters compete in race to get a coffee and croissant across the capital
Sentence: “You need to walk fast, but not too fast,” one female contestant told local radio station France Bleu.

Article Title: Paris waiters compete in race to get a coffee and croissant across the capital

Article Title: Paris waiters compete in race to get a coffee and croissant across the capital
Sentence: Water spilled, cups fell.

Article Title: Paris waiters compete in race to get a coffee and croissant across the capital
Sentence: One contestant shouted, “I can’t feel my fingers!”

Article Title: Paris waiters compete in race to get a coffee and croissant across the capital
Sentence: There were gasps, cheers and laughter from the thousands of Parisians who decided to fight the early spring chill to watch the return of this quintessential French event, which was canceled 12 years ago due to budget constraints.

Article Title: Paris waiters compete in race to get a coffee and croissant across the capital

Article Title: Paris waiters compete in race to get a coffee and croissant across the capital
Sentence:
Dimitar Dilkoff/AFP/Getty Images

‘Excellence of French service’

Article Title: Paris waiters compete in race to get a coffee and croissant across the capital
Sentence: It’s been revived to promote sport and “the excellence of French service” as the country gets ready to host the 2024 Summer Olympic and Paralympic Games, the Paris city government said in a statement earlier this year.

Article Title: Paris waiters compete in race to get a coffee and croissant across the capital
Sentence: Several city officials also participated in the race, including the mayor of central Paris, Ariel Weil and the two deputy mayors of Paris in charge of Olympic affairs and business, Pierre Rabadan and Nicolas Bonnet Oulaldj.

Article Title: Paris waiters compete in race to get a coffee and croissant across the capital
Sentence:
The “Course des Garçons de Café” (cafe waiters race) was first launched in 1914 to highlight the cafés and restaurants of the French capital, according to French historian Laurent Bihl.

Throughout the years, it found popularity not only in Paris but across France in cities such as Nice, Belfort and Calais.

Article Title: Paris waiters compete in race to get a coffee and croissant across the capital
Sentence: Across the English Channel, many towns in the UK have also adopted this race but added a little bit of local flavor – the coffee and croissant have been switched out for a pint of beer.

Article Title: Paris waiters compete in race to get a coffee and croissant across the capital
Sentence: Variations have also been staged in cities as far away as Hong Kong and Yokohama.

Article Title: Paris waiters compete in race to get a coffee and croissant across the capital
Sentence: Back on the streets of Paris, the quickest entrants completed Sunday’s Course des Cafés race – the name of the revived version has been shortened, dropping the ‘garçons’ – in less than 14 minutes.

Article Title: Paris waiters compete in race to get a coffee and croissant across the capital
Sentence: In the end, Pauline Van Wymeersch from the Café le Petit Pont and Samy Lamrous from La Contrescarpe were crowned the fastest woman and man.

Article Title: Paris waiters compete in race to get a coffee and croissant across the capital
Sentence: They both won tickets to the Olympic opening ceremony this summer – and perhaps some newfound respect from those customers cursing about the time it takes to order up a coffee, croissant and a glass of water.

Article Title: Alex Honnold, Hazel Findlay and Mikey Shaefer: How three cilmbers scaled one of the world’s largest unclimbed rock faces
Sentence:
CNN —

In a world now hyper connected by technology, transport links and our smartphone screens, there are few places that can truly be described as untouched.

Article Title: Alex Honnold, Hazel Findlay and Mikey Shaefer: How three cilmbers scaled one of the world’s largest unclimbed rock faces
Sentence: But for climber Alex Honnold, some such places, found in the harshest and most unforgiving of environments, still exist and are ripe for adventure.

Article Title: Alex Honnold, Hazel Findlay and Mikey Shaefer: How three cilmbers scaled one of the world’s largest unclimbed rock faces
Sentence: Honnold had palms sweating and pulses racing when he climbed Yosemite’s 3,200 foot granite monolith El Capitan without any safety ropes – a mind-boggling achievement immortalized in the breathtaking BAFTA and Oscar winning National Geographic documentary “Free Solo.”

Article Title: Alex Honnold, Hazel Findlay and Mikey Shaefer: How three cilmbers scaled one of the world’s largest unclimbed rock faces
Sentence: Following the success of the film and his rise to stardom, Honnold set his sights on Ingmikortilaq, a formidable and unclimbed 3,750-foot rock wall jutting from Greenland’s frigid icy waters.

Article Title: Alex Honnold, Hazel Findlay and Mikey Shaefer: How three cilmbers scaled one of the world’s largest unclimbed rock faces
Sentence: The steep rock is more than double the height of the Empire state building.

Article Title: Alex Honnold, Hazel Findlay and Mikey Shaefer: How three cilmbers scaled one of the world’s largest unclimbed rock faces
Sentence: “I’m never going to do another climbing project that goes to the Oscars, you know?

Article Title: Alex Honnold, Hazel Findlay and Mikey Shaefer: How three cilmbers scaled one of the world’s largest unclimbed rock faces
Sentence: I can just set that expectation aside and I can focus on the projects that I’m excited about, that I’m inspired by,” he tells CNN Sport.

Article Title: Alex Honnold, Hazel Findlay and Mikey Shaefer: How three cilmbers scaled one of the world’s largest unclimbed rock faces
Sentence: Climbers Alex Honnold, right, and Hazel Findlay assess the route ahead as they ascend Pool Wall, one of the stops before Ingmikortilaq, in Eastern Greenland.

Article Title: Alex Honnold, Hazel Findlay and Mikey Shaefer: How three cilmbers scaled one of the world’s largest unclimbed rock faces
Sentence:
Pablo Durana/National Geographic

The 38-year-old athlete, alongside pro climbers Hazel Findlay and Mikey Shaefer, ventured to the formidable seacliff, known locally as “the separate one,” in a six-week expedition that featured in National Geographic’s documentary “Arctic Ascent.”

Article Title: Alex Honnold, Hazel Findlay and Mikey Shaefer: How three cilmbers scaled one of the world’s largest unclimbed rock faces
Sentence: Honnold has done many first ascents all over the world, but says, that he’d “never done a first ascent of that magnitude, of a wall of that size.”

Article Title: Alex Honnold, Hazel Findlay and Mikey Shaefer: How three cilmbers scaled one of the world’s largest unclimbed rock faces
Sentence: Taking on one of the world’s biggest unscaled walls might be the stuff of dreams for any climber, but the conditions, less so: Honnold and his team were forced to battle unpredictable weather, snow storms, tumbling loose rock and delayed delivery of their climbing equipment.

Article Title: Alex Honnold, Hazel Findlay and Mikey Shaefer: How three cilmbers scaled one of the world’s largest unclimbed rock faces
Sentence: In spite of his reputation, Honnold is not entirely unflappable, describing sea cliff Ingmikortilaq as “pretty intimidating” and “daunting,” due to the swirling rock changing in rock type and quality.

Article Title: Alex Honnold, Hazel Findlay and Mikey Shaefer: How three cilmbers scaled one of the world’s largest unclimbed rock faces
Sentence: “The first time we saw the wall from the boat, we all were pretty, you know, we’re like, ‘Oh, no, that’s a lot’,” he says.

Article Title: Alex Honnold, Hazel Findlay and Mikey Shaefer: How three cilmbers scaled one of the world’s largest unclimbed rock faces
Sentence: Findlay, who took on the first ascent alongside Honnold, tells CNN even with careful planning and a TV crew, the team faced a surprising number of “unknowns,” not least the pressure and expectation they felt of working on the documentary.

Article Title: Alex Honnold, Hazel Findlay and Mikey Shaefer: How three cilmbers scaled one of the world’s largest unclimbed rock faces
Sentence: "Arctic Ascent With Alex Honnold."

Article Title: Alex Honnold, Hazel Findlay and Mikey Shaefer: How three cilmbers scaled one of the world’s largest unclimbed rock faces
Sentence:
Pablo Durana/National Geographic

“I think as a climber, you kind of get used to going into things with that level of unknown.

Article Title: Alex Honnold, Hazel Findlay and Mikey Shaefer: How three cilmbers scaled one of the world’s largest unclimbed rock faces
Sentence: I don’t know if you can really have an adventure without unknowns, that’s definitely just part of the experience,” Findlay explains.

Article Title: Alex Honnold, Hazel Findlay and Mikey Shaefer: How three cilmbers scaled one of the world’s largest unclimbed rock faces
Sentence: “But when you’re making it for a TV show, there’s this added pressure: you really do kind of have to succeed or otherwise that money gets wasted and people’s jobs are on the line.”

Article Title: Alex Honnold, Hazel Findlay and Mikey Shaefer: How three cilmbers scaled one of the world’s largest unclimbed rock faces
Sentence: After weeks of traveling to the cliff with a team including glaciologist Dr. Heïdi Sevestre, Greenlandic guide Adam Kjeldsen and adventurer Aldo Kane, the climbers set their sights on the formidable buttress.

Article Title: Alex Honnold, Hazel Findlay and Mikey Shaefer: How three cilmbers scaled one of the world’s largest unclimbed rock faces
Sentence: Ingmikortilaq mountain stands at a staggering 3,750 ft.

Sentence:
Matt Pycroft/National Geographic

“That wall was just really loose, it was just a lot harder to manage the risks, we felt like we could do everything possible to make it safe, and it still could be too dangerous,” Findlay adds.

Article Title: Alex Honnold, Hazel Findlay and Mikey Shaefer: How three cilmbers scaled one of the world’s largest unclimbed rock faces
Sentence: Honnold explains he approached the six-week expedition and “almost overwhelming challenge” of the climb the same way he does all his projects: “breaking things down into things that are manageable.”

Article Title: Alex Honnold, Hazel Findlay and Mikey Shaefer: How three cilmbers scaled one of the world’s largest unclimbed rock faces
Sentence: He adds: “I think a big part of doing things that other people find scary is broadening your comfort zone to the point that things that you used to think were scary are just no longer scary.

Article Title: Alex Honnold, Hazel Findlay and Mikey Shaefer: How three cilmbers scaled one of the world’s largest unclimbed rock faces
Sentence: “That has meant consistently scaring myself in different ways, consistently doing things that are a small step beyond what I felt comfortable with before.”

Article Title: Alex Honnold, Hazel Findlay and Mikey Shaefer: How three cilmbers scaled one of the world’s largest unclimbed rock faces
Sentence: He adds that 10 years ago, many aspects of the expedition would have been very scary for him.

Article Title: Alex Honnold, Hazel Findlay and Mikey Shaefer: How three cilmbers scaled one of the world’s largest unclimbed rock faces
Sentence: “If you do something routinely for 20 years, it’s just not that scary.

Article Title: Alex Honnold, Hazel Findlay and Mikey Shaefer: How three cilmbers scaled one of the world’s largest unclimbed rock faces
Sentence: I think a lot of viewers see that and they’re like, ‘Oh, he lives a normal life like I do, and then every once in a while he does things like this’.

Article Title: Alex Honnold, Hazel Findlay and Mikey Shaefer: How three cilmbers scaled one of the world’s largest unclimbed rock faces
Sentence: “No, no, this is what I do five days a week, all year round for the last 20 years,” he chuckles.

Article Title: Alex Honnold, Hazel Findlay and Mikey Shaefer: How three cilmbers scaled one of the world’s largest unclimbed rock faces
Sentence:
Warnings from a warming planet

Before making it to Ingmikortilaq, the team collected data to help inform a “health check” of Eastern Greenland, which hadn’t been completed in some 20 years.

Article Title: Alex Honnold, Hazel Findlay and Mikey Shaefer: How three cilmbers scaled one of the world’s largest unclimbed rock faces
Sentence: The team studied glaciers, icebergs, fjord waters, and rock faces with the aim of increasing our knowledge of the impact climate change is having on this vital, fragile part of our planet, which will have ultimately have reverberations across the world.

Article Title: Alex Honnold, Hazel Findlay and Mikey Shaefer: How three cilmbers scaled one of the world’s largest unclimbed rock faces
Sentence: This included a climb up a 1,500-foot rock face, known as the Pool Wall, to take real-time depth and density measurements of a rarely studied section of Greenland’s ice cap.

Article Title: Alex Honnold, Hazel Findlay and Mikey Shaefer: How three cilmbers scaled one of the world’s largest unclimbed rock faces
Sentence:
Pablo Durana/National Geographic

“Behind these really cool walls, we did some useful science.

Article Title: Alex Honnold, Hazel Findlay and Mikey Shaefer: How three cilmbers scaled one of the world’s largest unclimbed rock faces
Sentence: That is win, win, all the way across the world,” Honnold explains.

Article Title: Alex Honnold, Hazel Findlay and Mikey Shaefer: How three cilmbers scaled one of the world’s largest unclimbed rock faces
Sentence: “So much of modern science just has to do with access: if you can get the right person to the right place, they can make meaningful contributions to science with relatively little effort,” he adds.

Article Title: Alex Honnold, Hazel Findlay and Mikey Shaefer: How three cilmbers scaled one of the world’s largest unclimbed rock faces
Sentence: Sevestre tells CNN that the Arctic is currently warming three to four times faster than the rest of the world.

Article Title: Alex Honnold, Hazel Findlay and Mikey Shaefer: How three cilmbers scaled one of the world’s largest unclimbed rock faces
Sentence: “By being able to better understand what’s happening to Greenland, this helps us to provide better data and better projections on how the rest of the world could be impacted by Arctic changes,” she explains.

Article Title: Alex Honnold, Hazel Findlay and Mikey Shaefer: How three cilmbers scaled one of the world’s largest unclimbed rock faces
Sentence: A recent study from the California Institute of Technology found that the Greenland ice sheet is losing an average of 30 million metric tons of ice an hour on average, as a result of human-caused global warming.

Article Title: Alex Honnold, Hazel Findlay and Mikey Shaefer: How three cilmbers scaled one of the world’s largest unclimbed rock faces
Sentence: The team walk up Edward Bailey Glacier.

Article Title: Alex Honnold, Hazel Findlay and Mikey Shaefer: How three cilmbers scaled one of the world’s largest unclimbed rock faces
Sentence:
Matt Pycroft/National Geographic

Sevestre explains that “our present and our future is intimately connected to Greenland.”

Article Title: Alex Honnold, Hazel Findlay and Mikey Shaefer: How three cilmbers scaled one of the world’s largest unclimbed rock faces
Sentence: The island holds enough ice to increase sea levels by six to seven meters, adding that cities like London, New York and Miami are on the “front line,” she adds.

Article Title: Alex Honnold, Hazel Findlay and Mikey Shaefer: How three cilmbers scaled one of the world’s largest unclimbed rock faces
Sentence: “And at the moment, we have a choice: do we continue investing in fossil fuels as much as we are today?

Article Title: Alex Honnold, Hazel Findlay and Mikey Shaefer: How three cilmbers scaled one of the world’s largest unclimbed rock faces
Sentence: If we want to give a chance to Greenland and give a chance to our own collective future, we really need to think long and hard about how much we want it.”

Article Title: Alex Honnold, Hazel Findlay and Mikey Shaefer: How three cilmbers scaled one of the world’s largest unclimbed rock faces
Sentence: “We’re just agreeing passively to invest more and more into fossil fuels.

Article Title: Alex Honnold, Hazel Findlay and Mikey Shaefer: How three cilmbers scaled one of the world’s largest unclimbed rock faces
Sentence: But we really need to understand how high the stakes really are.

Article Title: Alex Honnold, Hazel Findlay and Mikey Shaefer: How three cilmbers scaled one of the world’s largest unclimbed rock faces
Sentence: We could totally get a meter of sea level rise by 2070.

Article Title: Alex Honnold, Hazel Findlay and Mikey Shaefer: How three cilmbers scaled one of the world’s largest unclimbed rock faces
Sentence: “I mean, this is tomorrow for the younger generations,” she adds.

Article Title: Barcelona’s famous Sagrada Familia will finally be completed in 2026
Sentence:
CNN —

The Sagrada Familia in Barcelona will finally be finished in 2026, more than 140 years after construction started, officials have confirmed.

Article Title: Barcelona’s famous Sagrada Familia will finally be completed in 2026
Sentence: The construction of the last of six towers will mark the completion of the structure of the basilica, the organization responsible for managing the site announced last week.

Article Title: Barcelona’s famous Sagrada Familia will finally be completed in 2026

Article Title: Barcelona’s famous Sagrada Familia will finally be completed in 2026
Sentence: When complete, the Sagrada Familia will become the world’s tallest church, overtaking Ulm Minster in Germany.

Article Title: Barcelona’s famous Sagrada Familia will finally be completed in 2026
Sentence: Construction began in 1882 according to a design spearheaded by celebrated Catalan architect Antoni Gaudí, who decided the monumental structure would have 18 huge, spindle-shaped towers, each symbolizing a different biblical figure—the 12 apostles, the four evangelists, the Virgin Mary and Jesus.

Article Title: Barcelona’s famous Sagrada Familia will finally be completed in 2026
Sentence:
The Sagrada Familia pictured in 1940 Hulton Archive/Getty Images

When Gaudí died in 1926, only an estimated 10%-15% of the project had been built, including one transept, a crypt and some of the apse wall.

Article Title: Barcelona’s famous Sagrada Familia will finally be completed in 2026
Sentence: Construction, already slow, was interrupted in the late 1930s by the Spanish Civil War, when most of the designs and models of Gaudí— whose tomb lies beneath the cathedral—were destroyed.

Article Title: Barcelona’s famous Sagrada Familia will finally be completed in 2026
Sentence: Current designs are based on surviving and reconstructed materials, as well as reimagined adaptations of the original.

Article Title: Barcelona’s famous Sagrada Familia will finally be completed in 2026
Sentence: In 1984, the building was designated a UNESCO World Heritage site, and it was consecrated by Pope Benedict XVI for religious worship in 2010.

Article Title: Barcelona’s famous Sagrada Familia will finally be completed in 2026
Sentence: The construction of the church was carried out illegally for 137 years, until 2019, when a building permit was finally issued by Barcelona’s city council.

Article Title: Barcelona’s famous Sagrada Familia will finally be completed in 2026

Article Title: Timeline of the Supreme Court’s mifepristone abortion pill ruling
Sentence:
CNN —

The fate of the abortion pill lies with the Supreme Court.

Article Title: Timeline of the Supreme Court’s mifepristone abortion pill ruling
Sentence: The high court, which has a conservative supermajority, holds the power to maintain full access to the drug or reverse regulation changes that made medication abortion more accessible in recent years.

Article Title: Timeline of the Supreme Court’s mifepristone abortion pill ruling
Sentence: This includes allowing the pills to be prescribed via telemedicine, delivered in the mail and used up to 10 weeks of pregnancy instead of seven.

Article Title: Timeline of the Supreme Court’s mifepristone abortion pill ruling
Sentence: In a lawsuit brought after the Supreme Court overturned Roe v. Wade in 2022, a federal judge in Texas ruled to suspend the US Food and Drug Administration’s approval of mifepristone — one of two pills used in most medication abortions.

Article Title: Timeline of the Supreme Court’s mifepristone abortion pill ruling
Sentence: The drug is still fully available while the Supreme Court deliberates.

Article Title: Timeline of the Supreme Court’s mifepristone abortion pill ruling
Sentence: Medication abortion accounts for nearly two-thirds of all US abortions, according to 2023 data from the Guttmacher Institute.

Article Title: Timeline of the Supreme Court’s mifepristone abortion pill ruling
Sentence: At least 5.9 million women have used mifepristone since its FDA approval in 2000.

Article Title: Timeline of the Supreme Court’s mifepristone abortion pill ruling
Sentence: It is also often prescribed for miscarriage treatment.

Article Title: Timeline of the Supreme Court’s mifepristone abortion pill ruling
Sentence:

Mifepristone’s safety is well-established.

Article Title: Timeline of the Supreme Court’s mifepristone abortion pill ruling
Sentence: Data analyzed by CNN shows it is safer than some common, low-risk prescription drugs, such as penicillin and Viagra.

Article Title: Timeline of the Supreme Court’s mifepristone abortion pill ruling
Sentence: It also comes with a lower risk of serious complications than the alternatives: procedural abortion and childbirth.

Article Title: Timeline of the Supreme Court’s mifepristone abortion pill ruling

Article Title: Kaduna, Nigeria: 137 school children kidnapped by gunmen released, state governor says
Sentence:
CNN —

At least 137 school children who were kidnapped by armed gunmen in Nigeria earlier this month have been released, the governor of Nigeria’s Kaduna state Uba Sani confirmed in a TV interview aired on Sunday.

Article Title: Kaduna, Nigeria: 137 school children kidnapped by gunmen released, state governor says
Sentence: In the interview broadcast on Nigeria’s Channels Television, Sani said he had met with the children’s families.

Article Title: Kaduna, Nigeria: 137 school children kidnapped by gunmen released, state governor says
Sentence: “I am happy, the families are happy, we are all happy the children have been rescued,” he told the broadcaster.

Article Title: Kaduna, Nigeria: 137 school children kidnapped by gunmen released, state governor says
Sentence: However, Sani said that a teacher had died after developing “some complications” while in captivity, without providing further detail.

Article Title: Kaduna, Nigeria: 137 school children kidnapped by gunmen released, state governor says
Sentence: On March 7, more than 300 students were abducted by armed bandits on motorcycles who stormed the LEA Primary and Secondary School in Kuriga village, in Kaduna’s Chikun district, state police told CNN at the time.

Article Title: Kaduna, Nigeria: 137 school children kidnapped by gunmen released, state governor says
Sentence: Kaduna state, which borders the Nigerian capital Abuja to the southwest, has grappled with recurring incidents of kidnappings for ransom by bandits and has witnessed several mass abductions in recent years.

Article Title: Kaduna, Nigeria: 137 school children kidnapped by gunmen released, state governor says
Sentence: In an earlier post on X, Sani was seen addressing dozens of children and wrote that he was “glad to see our released children in high spirits on Sunday evening.”

Article Title: Kaduna, Nigeria: 137 school children kidnapped by gunmen released, state governor says
Sentence: He wrote that they would continue to “undergo psychosocial counseling” and receive “proper medical supervision.”

Article Title: Kaduna, Nigeria: 137 school children kidnapped by gunmen released, state governor says
Sentence: The gunmen previously demanded a ransom of 1 billion naira ($620,000) and threatened to kill all of the students if their demands were not met, according to a member of the community.

Article Title: Kaduna, Nigeria: 137 school children kidnapped by gunmen released, state governor says
Sentence: Nigeria’s National Security Adviser Nuhu Ribadu had coordinated the “operations of the security agencies, which eventually resulted in this successful outcome,” Sani said.

Article Title: Kaduna, Nigeria: 137 school children kidnapped by gunmen released, state governor says
Sentence: “The Nigerian Army also deserves special commendation for showing that with courage, determination and commitment, criminal elements can be degraded and security restored in our communities,” Sani said.

Article Title: Kaduna, Nigeria: 137 school children kidnapped by gunmen released, state governor says
Sentence: He also thanked Nigeria’s President Bola Tinubu for “working round the clock” to ensure the children’s safe return.

Article Title: Kaduna, Nigeria: 137 school children kidnapped by gunmen released, state governor says
Sentence: With previous reporting from CNN’s Nimi Princewill in Abuja and Mariya Knight.

Article Title: Son Jun-ho: South Korean soccer player returns home after being detained in China on suspicion of accepting bribes
Sentence:
CNN —

South Korean soccer star Son Jun-ho, who was detained in China for allegedly accepting bribes, has recently returned home, the country’s Ministry of Foreign Affairs said in a statement on Monday.

Article Title: Son Jun-ho: South Korean soccer player returns home after being detained in China on suspicion of accepting bribes
Sentence: The ministry has been communicating with the Chinese authorities through “various channels” and requested cooperation to “ensure a swift and fair process,” it said without giving details of the release.

Article Title: Son Jun-ho: South Korean soccer player returns home after being detained in China on suspicion of accepting bribes
Sentence:
Son was detained by public security authorities in China’s northeast Liaoning province last May “on suspicion of taking bribes as a person who is not a functionary of a state organ.”

Son is a midfielder for Shandong Taishan, a soccer club in the Chinese Super League (CSL) which won the 2021 league title and more recently the 2022 Chinese Football Association Cup.

Article Title: Son Jun-ho: South Korean soccer player returns home after being detained in China on suspicion of accepting bribes
Sentence: He has also represented South Korea’s men’s national team and reached the knockout stages of the World Cup in 2022 with the squad.

Article Title: Son Jun-ho: South Korean soccer player returns home after being detained in China on suspicion of accepting bribes
Sentence: Son became the first foreign soccer player to be investigated and detained since the CSL started in 2004, according to China’s state-run Global Times.

Article Title: Son Jun-ho: South Korean soccer player returns home after being detained in China on suspicion of accepting bribes
Sentence: His arrest was part of a broader initiative by Beijing to rid Chinese soccer of alleged corruption in the highest levels of the sport, during which the Communist Party’s anti-graft watchdog has been investigating a host of Chinese Football Association figures.

Article Title: Everest climbers will have to take their poop away with them, as Nepal tries to address growing waste problem
Sentence: Check.

Article Title: Everest climbers will have to take their poop away with them, as Nepal tries to address growing waste problem
Sentence: Poop bags?… Check.

Article Title: Everest climbers will have to take their poop away with them, as Nepal tries to address growing waste problem
Sentence: Those hoping to climb Everest this year will have to make some slight adjustments to their packing list, as new rules now mandate that climbers bring their excrement down with them from the world’s highest peak, in a bid to tackle pollution.

Article Title: Everest climbers will have to take their poop away with them, as Nepal tries to address growing waste problem
Sentence: Most people who attempt to climb the 8,849-meter (29,032-foot) Mount Everest do so via Nepal, paying $11,000 apiece just for the climbing permit.

Article Title: Everest climbers will have to take their poop away with them, as Nepal tries to address growing waste problem
Sentence:
Mountaineers' tents at Camp 2 of Everest on May 8, 2021 Pemba Dorje Sherpa/AFP/Getty Images

With gear, food, supplemental oxygen, Sherpa guides and more, it costs upward of $35,000 to take on the mountain.

Article Title: Everest climbers will have to take their poop away with them, as Nepal tries to address growing waste problem
Sentence: But the world’s highest peak has a poop problem, driven by the number of visitors, and the harsh conditions on the mountain, which interfere with the degradation process.

Article Title: Everest climbers will have to take their poop away with them, as Nepal tries to address growing waste problem
Sentence: “The problem of human waste on Everest was very bad,” Diwas Pokhrel, first vice president of Everest Summiteers Association, told CNN, adding that at the mountain’s highest points, it was “polluting the mountain environment.”

Article Title: Everest climbers will have to take their poop away with them, as Nepal tries to address growing waste problem
Sentence: Without the new rules, the poo problem was highly likely to get worse: Last year, Nepal gave out a record 478 climbing permits to climb the peak.

Article Title: Everest climbers will have to take their poop away with them, as Nepal tries to address growing waste problem
Sentence: Twelve climbers were confirmed to have died on the mountain, while another five remain officially missing.

Article Title: Everest climbers will have to take their poop away with them, as Nepal tries to address growing waste problem
Sentence: Jinesh Sindurakar of the Nepal Mountaineering Association told CNN that an estimated 1,200 people will be on Everest this season.

Article Title: Everest climbers will have to take their poop away with them, as Nepal tries to address growing waste problem
Sentence: “Each person produces 250 grams (8.8 ounces) of excrement a day and they will spend 2 weeks on the higher camps for the summit push,” Sindurakar explained, adding that each climber will be given two poop bags, which can each be used six times.

Article Title: Everest climbers will have to take their poop away with them, as Nepal tries to address growing waste problem
Sentence: The bags contain chemicals to solidify the human waste and make it odorless, Sindurakar said, and Nepal’s Khumbu Pasanglhamu Rural Municipality will issue some 8,000 bags this season.

Article Title: Everest climbers will have to take their poop away with them, as Nepal tries to address growing waste problem
Sentence: Efforts to reduce the impact of tourism on the Himalayas have stepped up, with 35,708 kilograms of waste and plastics removed from peaks including Everest, Lhotse, Annapurna and Baruntse through an initiative led by the Nepali Army, according to the Himalayan Times.

Article Title: Everest climbers will have to take their poop away with them, as Nepal tries to address growing waste problem
Sentence: CNN’s Lilit Marcus contributed reporting

Article Title: Lunar eclipse: Here’s how to see the upcoming worm moon
Sentence: Sign up for CNN’s Wonder Theory science newsletter.

Article Title: Lunar eclipse: Here’s how to see the upcoming worm moon
Sentence: Explore the universe with news on fascinating discoveries, scientific advancements and more.

Article Title: Lunar eclipse: Here’s how to see the upcoming worm moon
Sentence:
CNN —

A glowing worm moon will light up the sky on Monday with a celestial performance in store for people venturing out in the early morning hours — a penumbral lunar eclipse.

Article Title: Lunar eclipse: Here’s how to see the upcoming worm moon
Sentence: March’s full moon, referred to as the worm moon by the Farmers’ Almanac due to its proximity to the spring equinox, will be at its fullest at 3 a.m. ET.

Article Title: Lunar eclipse: Here’s how to see the upcoming worm moon
Sentence: A few hours earlier, starting at 12:53 a.m. ET, according to EarthSky, the moon will be almost perfectly aligned with the sun and Earth, causing the outer edge of Earth’s shadow, known as the penumbra, to be cast onto the glowing orb.

Article Title: Lunar eclipse: Here’s how to see the upcoming worm moon
Sentence: The moon looks slightly darker during a 2023 penumbral lunar eclipse in Banda Aceh, Indonesia.

Article Title: Lunar eclipse: Here’s how to see the upcoming worm moon
Sentence: On Monday, the lunar event will begin at 12:53 a.m. ET.

Article Title: Lunar eclipse: Here’s how to see the upcoming worm moon
Sentence:
Chaideer Mahyuddin/AFP/Getty Images

The greatest eclipse will be at 3:12 a.m. ET, when the moon will appear to be slightly darker than usual, said Dr. Shannon Schmoll, director of the Abrams Planetarium at Michigan State University.

Article Title: Lunar eclipse: Here’s how to see the upcoming worm moon
Sentence: “It’ll be almost a gradient of darkening happening from one side of the moon to the other.

Article Title: Lunar eclipse: Here’s how to see the upcoming worm moon
Sentence: It’s not going to be a super dramatic change in what we see in the moon,” Schmoll said.

Article Title: Lunar eclipse: Here’s how to see the upcoming worm moon
Sentence: “But if you’re sitting there watching it, you might notice some slight variations in brightness.”

Article Title: Lunar eclipse: Here’s how to see the upcoming worm moon
Sentence: The worm moon — named by Native American tribes in reference to the beetle larvae and other creatures that emerge from hibernation in the spring — will be visible to everyone across the world, since the moon will appear to be full for a couple of days.

Article Title: Lunar eclipse: Here’s how to see the upcoming worm moon
Sentence: However, the penumbral eclipse will only be visible to those who are on the night side of Earth when the event occurs, including Europe, North and East Asia, Australia, Africa, North America and South America.

Article Title: Lunar eclipse: Here’s how to see the upcoming worm moon
Sentence: The lunar eclipse will finish at 5:33 a.m. ET, according to EarthSky.

Article Title: Lunar eclipse: Here’s how to see the upcoming worm moon
Sentence: The penumbral eclipse comes about two weeks before a total solar eclipse that will cross Mexico, the United States and Canada on April 8.

Article Title: Lunar eclipse: Here’s how to see the upcoming worm moon
Sentence: Lunar and solar eclipses always come in pairs due to the period when the sun, Earth and moon stay aligned, Schmoll said.

Article Title: Lunar eclipse: Here’s how to see the upcoming worm moon
Sentence: While the full moon will be caught in Earth’s shadow during this penumbral eclipse, the moon’s next new moon phase will allow for the conditions needed for a solar eclipse, when the moon will be in between the sun and Earth and thus block the face of the sun from view.

Article Title: Lunar eclipse: Here’s how to see the upcoming worm moon
Sentence:
Eclipse season

An “eclipse season” is the approximate 35-day period that occurs every six months, near the equinoxes, when the near-perfect alignment of the three celestial bodies needed for eclipses occurs, according to NASA.

Article Title: Lunar eclipse: Here’s how to see the upcoming worm moon
Sentence: A lunar eclipse does not happen monthly during each full moon because the moon’s orbital plane is tilted by about 5 degrees, so for most full moons, the shadow of the Earth will be just below or above the moon, Schmoll said.

Article Title: Lunar eclipse: Here’s how to see the upcoming worm moon
Sentence: While a penumbral eclipse is not as dramatic as a total lunar eclipse with the moon appearing an eerie red, there is no special equipment required to view a lunar eclipse such as the viewing glasses needed for a solar eclipse, Schmoll said, allowing for lunar eclipses to be viewed with the naked eye.

Article Title: Lunar eclipse: Here’s how to see the upcoming worm moon
Sentence: “You pretty much just need to be outside with a clear view of the moon when it’s happening,” Schmoll added.

Article Title: Lunar eclipse: Here’s how to see the upcoming worm moon
Sentence: “(Eclipses are) always a good excuse to go outside and try to look at the sky and appreciate where we are in the universe, and what we are able to observe from our planet.”

Article Title: Lunar eclipse: Here’s how to see the upcoming worm moon
Sentence:
Solar and lunar eclipses

While the most highly anticipated of the four eclipse events occurring in 2024 is the total solar eclipse on April 8, an annular solar eclipse will occur on October 2 over parts of South America.

Article Title: Lunar eclipse: Here’s how to see the upcoming worm moon
Sentence: This type of eclipse is similar to a total solar eclipse, except the moon is at the farthest point in its orbit from Earth, so it can’t completely block the sun.

Article Title: Lunar eclipse: Here’s how to see the upcoming worm moon
Sentence: Instead, annular solar eclipses create a “ring of fire” in the sky as the sun’s fiery light surrounds the moon’s shadow.

Article Title: Lunar eclipse: Here’s how to see the upcoming worm moon
Sentence:
Meanwhile, a partial lunar eclipse, in which Earth moves between the sun and the full moon without being perfectly aligned, will appear over Europe and much of Asia, Africa, North America and South America between September 17 and 18.

Check Time and Date’s website to see when each of these eclipses will appear.

Article Title: Lunar eclipse: Here’s how to see the upcoming worm moon
Sentence:
More full moons this year

Of the 12 full moons in 2024, the September and October lunar events will be considered supermoons, according to EarthSky.

Article Title: Lunar eclipse: Here’s how to see the upcoming worm moon
Sentence: Definitions of a supermoon can vary, but the term generally denotes a full moon that is closer to Earth than normal and thus appears larger and brighter in the night sky.

Article Title: Lunar eclipse: Here’s how to see the upcoming worm moon
Sentence: Some astronomers say the phenomenon occurs when the moon is within 90% of perigee — its closest approach to Earth in orbit.

Article Title: Lunar eclipse: Here’s how to see the upcoming worm moon
Sentence:
Here are the remaining full moons of 2024:

• April 23: Pink moon

• May 23: Flower moon

• June 21: Strawberry moon

• July 21: Buck moon

• August 19: Sturgeon moon

• September 17: Harvest moon

• October 17: Hunter’s moon

• November 15: Beaver moon

• December 15: Cold moon

Meteor showers of 2024

Skygazers can look forward to a multitude of meteor showers this year, according to the American Meteor Society.

Article Title: Lunar eclipse: Here’s how to see the upcoming worm moon
Sentence: Here are the dates when meteor events are expected to peak this year.

Article Title: Lunar eclipse: Here’s how to see the upcoming worm moon
Sentence:
• Lyrids: April 21-22

• Eta Aquariids: May 4-5

• Southern delta

Sentence:
Aquariids: July 29-30

• Perseids: August 11-12

• Draconids: October 7-8
