Article Title: WindRunner: Gigantic new aircraft design aims to create the largest plane ever to fly
Sentence:
CNN —

There’s a global energy crisis and onshore wind farms are a potential growth option.

Article Title: WindRunner: Gigantic new aircraft design aims to create the largest plane ever to fly
Sentence: Larger wind turbines produce more power than standard ones, but the components are too big to be transported by road.

Article Title: WindRunner: Gigantic new aircraft design aims to create the largest plane ever to fly
Sentence: What’s the solution?

Article Title: WindRunner: Gigantic new aircraft design aims to create the largest plane ever to fly
Sentence: A Colorado-based energy startup named Radia has an idea.

Article Title: WindRunner: Gigantic new aircraft design aims to create the largest plane ever to fly
Sentence: It’s developing the biggest aircraft in aviation history.

Article Title: WindRunner: Gigantic new aircraft design aims to create the largest plane ever to fly
Sentence: Meet the WindRunner airplane, whose mission will be to deliver gigantic 300-foot-long blades directly to wind farms.

Article Title: WindRunner: Gigantic new aircraft design aims to create the largest plane ever to fly
Sentence: To help the world meet its decarbonization targets, it’ll use sustainable aviation fuel and needs only a simple packed-dirt or gravel runway to land on.

Article Title: WindRunner: Gigantic new aircraft design aims to create the largest plane ever to fly
Sentence: It’ll operate from regional hubs, says Radia, delivering where needed – and “can land on airstrips as short as 6,000 feet (1,800 meters), something no other large commercial aircraft can achieve.”

Article Title: WindRunner: Gigantic new aircraft design aims to create the largest plane ever to fly
Sentence: Where do the pilots go?

Article Title: WindRunner: Gigantic new aircraft design aims to create the largest plane ever to fly
Sentence: Right up top.

Article Title: WindRunner: Gigantic new aircraft design aims to create the largest plane ever to fly
Sentence:
Radia

Let’s talk about specs, baby

When it comes to carrying the largest payloads ever moved by air, dainty just isn’t going to cut it.

Article Title: WindRunner: Gigantic new aircraft design aims to create the largest plane ever to fly
Sentence: So WindRunner will have a cargo bay volume of 272,000 cubic feet, enough to hold three Olympic swimming pools.

Article Title: WindRunner: Gigantic new aircraft design aims to create the largest plane ever to fly
Sentence: That’s 12 times the volume of a Boeing 747-400 and – at 356 feet in length, it’s 127 feet longer too.

Article Title: WindRunner: Gigantic new aircraft design aims to create the largest plane ever to fly
Sentence: As for the wingspan, that’s 261 feet – imagine four bowling lanes laid end to end.

Article Title: WindRunner: Gigantic new aircraft design aims to create the largest plane ever to fly
Sentence: It will also dwarf the Antonov An-225, the heaviest aircraft ever built, which was destroyed at the start of Russia’s invasion of Ukraine.

Article Title: WindRunner: Gigantic new aircraft design aims to create the largest plane ever to fly
Sentence: The aircraft’s scale might be groundbreaking, but the engineering is not – and that’s by design.

Article Title: WindRunner: Gigantic new aircraft design aims to create the largest plane ever to fly
Sentence: Radia says it’s focusing “on existing technology and safety by using, where applicable, tried-and-true aviation materials, components and fabrication techniques that have FAA [US Federal Aviation Administration] approval, are already in mass production and are lowest-risk.”

Article Title: WindRunner: Gigantic new aircraft design aims to create the largest plane ever to fly
Sentence: The idea is to hit the ground running with a fast, well-built fleet that meets aerospace industry standards.

Article Title: WindRunner: Gigantic new aircraft design aims to create the largest plane ever to fly
Sentence: Online reports say commercial operations as soon as 2027, but there’s no timeline confirmed on Radia’s website.

Article Title: WindRunner: Gigantic new aircraft design aims to create the largest plane ever to fly
Sentence: CNN has reached out to the company for comment.

Article Title: WindRunner: Gigantic new aircraft design aims to create the largest plane ever to fly
Sentence: Radia has patented a system for loading blades into WindRunner.

Article Title: WindRunner: Gigantic new aircraft design aims to create the largest plane ever to fly
Sentence:
Radia

There she blows

Radia is banking on research organisation Bloomberg NEF’s estimation that up to $10 trillion will be spent on onshore wind through 2050.

Article Title: WindRunner: Gigantic new aircraft design aims to create the largest plane ever to fly
Sentence: The development of WindRunner is to enable GigaWind, the XXL turbines made by Radia’s partners, which include five of the world’s top six turbine manufacturers.

Article Title: WindRunner: Gigantic new aircraft design aims to create the largest plane ever to fly
Sentence: Currently, turbine blades today are ordinarily 230 feet or less (70 meters), but Radia wants to deploy blades of up to 104 meters (341 feet).

Article Title: WindRunner: Gigantic new aircraft design aims to create the largest plane ever to fly
Sentence: The company says GigaWind turbines could potentially be two to three times more powerful – and two to three times more profitable than those typically deployed today.

Article Title: WindRunner: Gigantic new aircraft design aims to create the largest plane ever to fly
Sentence: So who are the folks behind these ambitious claims?

Article Title: WindRunner: Gigantic new aircraft design aims to create the largest plane ever to fly
Sentence: The founder and CEO is Mark Lundstrum, a cross-industry entrepreneur and MIT aerospace engineer who founded Radia in 2016.

Article Title: WindRunner: Gigantic new aircraft design aims to create the largest plane ever to fly
Sentence: The company says its team of advisers include former top brass from Boeing, MIT, Rolls-Royce and the FAA, as well as former US Secretary of Energy Ernest Moniz and former Prime Minister of Australia Malcolm Turnbull.

Article Title: WindRunner: Gigantic new aircraft design aims to create the largest plane ever to fly
Sentence: It’s an impressive lineup and the decision to focus on safe, existing technology is a smart one.

Article Title: WindRunner: Gigantic new aircraft design aims to create the largest plane ever to fly
Sentence: Might we see a WindRunner take off before the end of the decade?

Article Title: WindRunner: Gigantic new aircraft design aims to create the largest plane ever to fly
Sentence: Could its distinctive shape one day be as popular as the Beluga XL transporter planes created by Airbus?

Article Title: WindRunner: Gigantic new aircraft design aims to create the largest plane ever to fly
Sentence: Watch the skies.

Article Title: Andre Lima vs. Igor Severino: UFC fighter disqualified for biting opponent
Sentence:
CNN —

UFC fighter Igor Severino was disqualified from his fight on Saturday night after biting his opponent, Andre Lima.

Article Title: Andre Lima vs. Igor Severino: UFC fighter disqualified for biting opponent
Sentence: In the second round of their flyweight bout in Las Vegas, Lima was being held from behind by Severino before the 20-year-old appeared to lean in and bite Lima on his left arm.

Article Title: Andre Lima vs. Igor Severino: UFC fighter disqualified for biting opponent
Sentence: Lima let out an audible shout before referee Chris Tognoni stopped the fight and announced that Severino had been disqualified from the fight, awarding the win to Lima.

Article Title: Andre Lima vs. Igor Severino: UFC fighter disqualified for biting opponent
Sentence: Lima posed for photos after his victory, with a bite mark visible on his left arm.

Article Title: Andre Lima vs. Igor Severino: UFC fighter disqualified for biting opponent
Sentence: According to martial arts journalist Kevin Iole, UFC president Dana White said in a text message that Severino had been released from the organization following the disqualification.

Article Title: Andre Lima vs. Igor Severino: UFC fighter disqualified for biting opponent
Sentence: “Those were two up-and-coming undefeated fighters,” White said, according to Iole.

Article Title: Andre Lima vs. Igor Severino: UFC fighter disqualified for biting opponent
Sentence: “If you get frustrated and want out of the fight, there are plenty of ways to do it, but the worst thing you can do is bite your opponent.

Article Title: Andre Lima vs. Igor Severino: UFC fighter disqualified for biting opponent
Sentence: “Now you get cut and lose the biggest opportunity of your life.

Article Title: Andre Lima vs. Igor Severino: UFC fighter disqualified for biting opponent
Sentence: Not to mention, he’s going to have real problems with the NSAC (Nevada State Athletic Commission).”

Article Title: Andre Lima vs. Igor Severino: UFC fighter disqualified for biting opponent
Sentence: Lima didn’t appear too bothered by the incident though, posting on Instagram in the hours after his fight that he had got a tattoo of the bite to commemorate it.

Article Title: Andre Lima vs. Igor Severino: UFC fighter disqualified for biting opponent
Sentence: The tattoo is in the same location as the original bite and appears to recreate the bitemarks left on his arm from Severino.

Article Title: Andre Lima vs. Igor Severino: UFC fighter disqualified for biting opponent
Sentence: White appeared impressed by Lima’s tattoo, posting on his Instagram story that he would double the Brazilian’s fight bonus to $50,000, saying: “This is AWESOME.”

Article Title: Andre Lima vs. Igor Severino: UFC fighter disqualified for biting opponent
Sentence: The UFC’s own social media accounts humorously commemorated the moment, coining Lima’s fight the “bite of the night,” a play on their more traditional “fight of the night” accolade.

Article Title: Andre Lima vs. Igor Severino: UFC fighter disqualified for biting opponent
Sentence: “I was able to hit him really hard, but then he bit me when I was trying to take him down.

Article Title: Andre Lima vs. Igor Severino: UFC fighter disqualified for biting opponent
Sentence: That’s why I yelled,” Lima said in the octagon after his fight.

Article Title: Andre Lima vs. Igor Severino: UFC fighter disqualified for biting opponent
Sentence: It was an unconventional way for Lima to earn his first UFC victory as he was making his debut in the competition on Saturday.

Article Title: Andre Lima vs. Igor Severino: UFC fighter disqualified for biting opponent
Sentence: He remains undefeated in his MMA career, while the disqualification is Severino’s first defeat.

Article Title: The painter reframing ‘dandies’ for the female gaze
Sentence:
CNN —

Writing in 1863, the French poet and critic Charles Baudelaire turned his eye to a striking faction of Parisian and English high society, one militantly fanatical for appearances — so much that some were said to polish their boots with Champagne.

Article Title: The painter reframing ‘dandies’ for the female gaze
Sentence: “Dandyism is a mysterious institution,” he said of the cult of the fastidiously-dressed, 19th-century male, “no less peculiar than the duel.”

Article Title: The painter reframing ‘dandies’ for the female gaze
Sentence: Though himself no stranger to decadence — with a predilection for satin, velvet and changing his hair on a whim, Baudelaire squandered an inheritance with his louche taste for clothing and opium — he identified in the dandy’s subversive character a “burning desire to create a personal form of originality.”

Article Title: The painter reframing ‘dandies’ for the female gaze
Sentence: Scores of subcultures have embraced and interpreted the archetype in the decades since.

Article Title: The painter reframing ‘dandies’ for the female gaze
Sentence: Rather than Beau Brummell’s crisply-tied cravat, today the term “dandy” may summon visions of Harry Styles in a string of freshwater pearls or playwright Jeremy O. Harris’ natty Thom Browne suiting.

Article Title: The painter reframing ‘dandies’ for the female gaze
Sentence: But its preening, self-curated elegance remains, beyond limits of the gender binary or preconceived notions of how one “should” dress.

Article Title: The painter reframing ‘dandies’ for the female gaze
Sentence: “There’s not one definitive description,” observed the British artist Sarah Ball in a video call with CNN.

Article Title: The painter reframing ‘dandies’ for the female gaze
Sentence: “Gender norms are so blurred now, fantastically.

Article Title: The painter reframing ‘dandies’ for the female gaze
Sentence:
It’s a moving scale, wherever we choose to be.”

"Von," a subject featured in two of Ball's "Tilted" portraits, pictured here in a Puritan-style bonnet and gown.

Article Title: The painter reframing ‘dandies’ for the female gaze
Sentence:
Todd-White Art Photography/Courtesy Friedman Gallery

"Henry," also twice a sitter for Ball, pictured here in a shirt, tie and louche beret.

Article Title: The painter reframing ‘dandies’ for the female gaze
Sentence:
Todd-White Art Photography/Courtesy Friedman Gallery

The concept of the dandy in the twenty-first century — and how it may be defined or disrupted — is the connective thread of Ball’s first New York solo exhibition, “Tilted,” which debuted at Stephen Friedman Gallery in Tribeca earlier this year.

Article Title: The painter reframing ‘dandies’ for the female gaze
Sentence: Comprising 10 large-scale, tightly composed portraits in Ball’s signature airy stretches of color, the show challenges conventions of gender and celebrates the exuberance of self-expression.

Article Title: The painter reframing ‘dandies’ for the female gaze
Sentence: Each of the personalities represented in “Tilted” is dressed in their own idiosyncratic accoutrements, rendered in minute detail: rakish beribboned headgear, delicate lace collars and bonnets, expressive makeup, oversized eyewear and, in one instance, even a cocktail glass, holding a slosh of liquid and the briny green of a Castelvetrano olive.

Article Title: The painter reframing ‘dandies’ for the female gaze
Sentence: Ball — who works from a studio in the small English town of St Ives, Cornwall, where artists have been drawn to the light and the sea for generations — typically finds her subjects through social media or on the street, attracted by their “degree of complete individuality,” she told CNN.

Article Title: The painter reframing ‘dandies’ for the female gaze
Sentence: Exploring the dandy persona has been a natural development for Ball, whose work needles the tension between self-identity and the performance of outward presentation.

Article Title: The painter reframing ‘dandies’ for the female gaze
Sentence: “It’s part of a much bigger idea: how we are defined by others or how we define ourselves.

Article Title: The painter reframing ‘dandies’ for the female gaze
Sentence: That can be anything — race, ethnicity, or religion, or sexuality or gender fluidity,” she told CNN.

Article Title: The painter reframing ‘dandies’ for the female gaze
Sentence: “I’ve always been very interested in how we present a version of ourselves externally; how our personality manifests itself.”

Article Title: The painter reframing ‘dandies’ for the female gaze
Sentence: For all the wit in the clothes, there is a stillness and a surreal quality in Ball’s portraits that place her subjects slightly out of time.

Article Title: The painter reframing ‘dandies’ for the female gaze
Sentence: “That is definitely something I seek when I’m looking for people to paint,” she said.

Article Title: The painter reframing ‘dandies’ for the female gaze
Sentence: Indelible personal style is also crucial to the allure.

Article Title: The painter reframing ‘dandies’ for the female gaze
Sentence: Ball doesn’t costume her subjects, though she edits details to balance the composition.

Article Title: The painter reframing ‘dandies’ for the female gaze
Sentence: “They’re ready-made, in a way,” she explained, “but then the painting really does take over.”

Article Title: The painter reframing ‘dandies’ for the female gaze
Sentence: Ball's 2023 painting "Declan (In Simone Rocha With Eddie)."

Article Title: The painter reframing ‘dandies’ for the female gaze
Sentence: Ball imbues the pair with a self-composure that borders on stoicism; together, they project an imperiousness akin to a Holbein patron.

Article Title: The painter reframing ‘dandies’ for the female gaze
Sentence: Todd-White Art Photography/Courtesy Friedman Gallery

Article Title: The painter reframing ‘dandies’ for the female gaze
Sentence: At over eight feet tall, “Declan (In Simone Rocha With Eddie),” depicts an individual in a sumptuous, crystal-embroidered smock dress by the Irish designer, known for her rebellious take on historic ritual, “feminine” codes and gender play.

Article Title: The painter reframing ‘dandies’ for the female gaze
Sentence: Accompanied by their long-haired guinea pig Eddie, swaddled in a lace-edged handkerchief, Declan’s coiffed shag haircut could read 18th century Flanders — or any contemporary hipster enclave, be it in Brooklyn or Berlin.

Article Title: The painter reframing ‘dandies’ for the female gaze
Sentence: An encounter with the writer Andrew Solomon’s 2004 essay Dandyism, published years before Instagram and other social media became the de facto avenue for exhibitionist display, influenced the body of work, according to Ball.

Article Title: The painter reframing ‘dandies’ for the female gaze
Sentence: “I’ve always looked (at) and used historical archives as a way of connecting with what’s happening in the world at the moment,” Ball said.

Article Title: The painter reframing ‘dandies’ for the female gaze
Sentence: “It’s a bit tongue in cheek, but the idea of ‘promenade’ in showing oneself peacocking is the same as people use social media for, really.”

Article Title: The painter reframing ‘dandies’ for the female gaze
Sentence: (Cue Solomon, quoting the French novelist Jules Barbey d’Aurevilly, “To appear to be is to be for Dandies.”)

Article Title: The painter reframing ‘dandies’ for the female gaze
Sentence: Ball's engaging, enigmatic portraits withhold any narrative about their sitters, instead emphasizing physical and aesthetic characteristics that offer an interpretation of the self.

Article Title: The painter reframing ‘dandies’ for the female gaze
Sentence:
Olympia Shannon/Courtesy Friedman Gallery

Two figures in the show, Von and Henry, materialize in multiple guises, demonstrating the transformativeness of persona construction and the depth of what may lie beyond the surface.

Article Title: The painter reframing ‘dandies’ for the female gaze
Sentence: “I’m aware that Instagram allows us to curate an image, an idea of ourselves, but unless you know that person, you don’t really ever know whether that’s true,” Ball noted.

Article Title: The painter reframing ‘dandies’ for the female gaze
Sentence: “There’s that intersection where truth meets fiction.”

Article Title: The painter reframing ‘dandies’ for the female gaze
Sentence: Her interpretations on the dandy shows how mutable and fluid the persona is, as Ball name-checks a series of female inspirations for the ‘look;’ the outré trouser suits and cropped bobs introduced by designer Gabrielle “Coco” Chanel, screen cipher Marlene Dietrich and Sandy Powell, the flame-haired, bespectacled costume designer known for her collaborations with directors Martin Scorsese and Todd Haynes.

Article Title: The painter reframing ‘dandies’ for the female gaze
Sentence: What remains is pure individual verve.

Article Title: The painter reframing ‘dandies’ for the female gaze
Sentence: “I’ve always been drawn to people that have not followed one path or another…who are extroverts, theatrical, unusual, creative, and wonderful,” Ball said.

Article Title: Emily Ratajkowski has changed her engagement ring into two ‘divorce rings’
Sentence:
CNN —

Diamonds are forever – especially for Emily Ratajkowski, who has chosen to turn her engagement ring into something entirely new following her split from her film producer husband, Sebastian Bear-McClard.

Article Title: Emily Ratajkowski has changed her engagement ring into two ‘divorce rings’
Sentence: With the help of Alison Chemla, creative director of jewelry brand Alison Lou, Ratajkowski worked to remake her old engagement ring, which featured a pear-shaped and a princess-cut diamond, into two separate rings.

Article Title: Emily Ratajkowski has changed her engagement ring into two ‘divorce rings’
Sentence: “The rings represent my own personal evolution,” the model told Vogue.

Article Title: Emily Ratajkowski has changed her engagement ring into two ‘divorce rings’
Sentence: “I don’t think a woman should be stripped of her diamonds just because she’s losing a man.”

Article Title: Emily Ratajkowski has changed her engagement ring into two ‘divorce rings’
Sentence: Now, the pear-shaped diamond sits on Ratajkowski’s pinkie finger, while the princess cut has been flanked by more trapezoid stones and turned into a new sparkler.

Article Title: Emily Ratajkowski has changed her engagement ring into two ‘divorce rings’
Sentence: Ratajkowski went on to explain that she got the idea after reading Stephanie Danler’s story “The Unravelers” in The Paris Review.

Article Title: Emily Ratajkowski has changed her engagement ring into two ‘divorce rings’
Sentence: Ratajkowski told Vogue she was inspired by a story in The Paris Review in which the author writes of a grandmother's ring made of stones from her previous marriages.

Article Title: Emily Ratajkowski has changed her engagement ring into two ‘divorce rings’
Sentence:
From Emily Ratajkowski/Instagram

“(It) includes the story of her grandmother’s snake ring—a ring that is made up of the different stones from her various marriages,” said Ratajkowski, who was catapulted to fame after she appeared in the music video for Robin Thicke’s 2013 track “Blurred Lines.”

Article Title: Emily Ratajkowski has changed her engagement ring into two ‘divorce rings’
Sentence: “I loved the idea of a ring unabashedly representing the many lives a woman has lived.”

Article Title: Emily Ratajkowski has changed her engagement ring into two ‘divorce rings’
Sentence: The model, who shares a son with Bear-McClard, added that creating the rings was a “fun project” to work on “amidst a hugely transitional period in my life.”

Article Title: Emily Ratajkowski has changed her engagement ring into two ‘divorce rings’
Sentence: “The ring became symbolic to me—some kind of token or evidence of my life becoming my own again,” she said.

Article Title: Emily Ratajkowski has changed her engagement ring into two ‘divorce rings’
Sentence: “Somehow, these rings feel like a reminder that I can make myself happy in ways I never imagined,” she added.

Article Title: Peru recovers 4,600 culturally significant items from across US and Europe
Sentence:
CNN —

More than 4,000 culturally significant items, including textiles, ceramics, and clothing, have been repatriated to Peru, their country of origin, the Peruvian Ministry of Foreign Affairs said in a statement.

Article Title: Peru recovers 4,600 culturally significant items from across US and Europe
Sentence: The 4,600 cultural assets were returned to the South American country from the United States and countries across Europe including Germany, Italy, and Switzerland, the foreign ministry said Wednesday.

Article Title: Peru recovers 4,600 culturally significant items from across US and Europe
Sentence: According to the statement, Peru’s Ministry of Culture and Ministry of Foreign Affairs worked alongside local authorities, consulates and embassies in the countries where the objects were located to bring them back to Peru.

Article Title: Peru recovers 4,600 culturally significant items from across US and Europe
Sentence: Peru's foreign minister, Javier González-Olaechea, speaks at a ceremony marking the return of the cultural assets in Lima on Wednesday.

Article Title: Peru recovers 4,600 culturally significant items from across US and Europe
Sentence:
Sebastian Castaneda/Reuters

Of the items returned, 4,556 came from a collection of archaeological material belonging to the late American archaeologist and anthropologist John Rowe, the statement said.

Article Title: Peru recovers 4,600 culturally significant items from across US and Europe
Sentence: Another 33 were returned from Italy – 21 of which were previously seized by Italian authorities from an art gallery, the statement continued.

Article Title: Peru recovers 4,600 culturally significant items from across US and Europe
Sentence: Among these items were clothing and ceramics from the Nazca, Wari, Inca, Paracas and Chimú cultures, it said.

Article Title: Peru recovers 4,600 culturally significant items from across US and Europe
Sentence: A silver incense burner from the 18th or 19th century was returned from Portugal, the Ministry of Foreign Affairs said, and other archaeological items were voluntarily returned from Germany and the Netherlands.

Article Title: Peru recovers 4,600 culturally significant items from across US and Europe
Sentence: Swiss authorities also seized and repatriated four pieces of pre-Hispanic ceramics, the statement continued.

Article Title: Peru recovers 4,600 culturally significant items from across US and Europe
Sentence: Recovered Inca textiles are displayed at the Foreign Ministry in Lima, Peru, Wednesday, March 20, 2024.

Article Title: Peru recovers 4,600 culturally significant items from across US and Europe
Sentence:
Miguel Paredes Haro/AP

“Since 2019, Peru has managed to recover more than 7,000 pieces of its cultural heritage, establishing itself as an international benchmark in the fight against illicit trafficking of cultural property,” Peru’s foreign minister, Javier González-Olaechea, said at a ceremony marking the return of the objects.

Article Title: Peru recovers 4,600 culturally significant items from across US and Europe
Sentence: “We will continue on this upward path in strengthening sovereignty over our precious heritage, because the cultural legacy of Peru is a fundamental pillar for the formation of our identity as Peruvians,” Leslie Urteaga, the country’s culture minister, said, according to a post on the Ministry of Culture’s X account.

Article Title: The Star, LA: Plans for $1-billion Hollywood tower by Norman Foster unveiled
Sentence:
CNN —

Celebrated architect Norman Foster has unveiled plans for a new $1-billion office tower in ﻿Los Angeles that will see greenery spilling out from a series of terraces spiraling up its facade.

Article Title: The Star, LA: Plans for $1-billion Hollywood tower by Norman Foster unveiled
Sentence: The eye-catching proposal, which was formally submitted to city planning authorities this week, will transform a two-acre site on Hollywood’s Sunset Boulevard into a 22-story entertainment industry workplace dubbed The Star.

Article Title: The Star, LA: Plans for $1-billion Hollywood tower by Norman Foster unveiled
Sentence: Digital impressions of the high-rise, released by the British architect’s firm Foster + Partners on Wednesday, show elevated gardens bursting with plants and trees, as well as outdoor decks and modern office space.

Article Title: The Star, LA: Plans for $1-billion Hollywood tower by Norman Foster unveiled
Sentence: A digital rendering shows an outdoor deck with views over the Hollywood Hills and the landmark Hollywood sign.

Article Title: The Star, LA: Plans for $1-billion Hollywood tower by Norman Foster unveiled
Sentence:
Foster + Partners

In a statement, Foster described it as a “true reflection of the workplace of the future, nurturing community, wellbeing and collaboration.”

Comprised largely of offices and billed as “a modern landmark,” The Star will house entertainment firms and “Hollywood’s top content creators,” said Foster + Partners.

Article Title: The Star, LA: Plans for $1-billion Hollywood tower by Norman Foster unveiled
Sentence: Current plans include production space, a gallery, a screening theater, a rooftop restaurant and “community gathering spaces” at ground level.

Article Title: The Star, LA: Plans for $1-billion Hollywood tower by Norman Foster unveiled
Sentence: The proposal, which is set across 525,000 square feet of floor space, replaces an earlier plan for the site unveiled in 2019.

Article Title: The Star, LA: Plans for $1-billion Hollywood tower by Norman Foster unveiled
Sentence: Designed by MAD Architects, the Chinese firm behind the curvilinear Lucas Museum of Narrative Art (which is set to open in LA next year), the original circular design featured a funicular railway wrapping around the exterior.

Article Title: The Star, LA: Plans for $1-billion Hollywood tower by Norman Foster unveiled
Sentence: The scheme was reportedly set to cost $500 million, half the price of the new proposal.

Article Title: The Star, LA: Plans for $1-billion Hollywood tower by Norman Foster unveiled
Sentence: Asked why the tower’s developer, Maggie Gong Miracle, abandoned the original plan, a spokesperson for the project told CNN that Foster’s new design — which is the same height, but thinner than the previous proposal — was intended to be an “asset to the community” that “respected the views” enjoyed by those living in the Hollywood Hills, which overlook the site.

Article Title: The Star, LA: Plans for $1-billion Hollywood tower by Norman Foster unveiled
Sentence: An aerial view of the terraces set to spiral up through the 22-story tower.

Article Title: The Star, LA: Plans for $1-billion Hollywood tower by Norman Foster unveiled
Sentence: The announcement comes as LA’s real estate market struggles to recover from the impact of the Covid-19 pandemic, Hollywood writers strikes and the growth of remote and hybrid working.

Article Title: The Star, LA: Plans for $1-billion Hollywood tower by Norman Foster unveiled
Sentence: More than a quarter of the city’s office space — rising to almost 30% in downtown LA — is currently vacant, according to the latest data from property brokerage Savills.

Article Title: The Star, LA: Plans for $1-billion Hollywood tower by Norman Foster unveiled
Sentence: Should the city greenlight the proposal, construction on The Star will start by early 2026 and complete in 2029.

Article Title: Polly Braden spent two years documenting life for the women forced to leave Ukraine
Sentence:
CNN —

Within hours of the Russian invasion in February 2022, Ukraine’s President Volodymyr Zelensky invoked martial law across the country, setting in motion an ongoing defence operation and signing a decree to mobilize conscripts.

Article Title: Polly Braden spent two years documenting life for the women forced to leave Ukraine
Sentence: With eligible men aged between 18-60 not being allowed to leave Ukraine, news reports were filled with images of mostly women and young children fleeing the country, wrapped in blankets or with grandparents nearby.

Article Title: Polly Braden spent two years documenting life for the women forced to leave Ukraine
Sentence: Like many of us, in the early days of the war, British photographer Polly Braden’s grasp of what was happening was informed by TV and newspaper coverage.

Article Title: Polly Braden spent two years documenting life for the women forced to leave Ukraine
Sentence: In it, she recognized the correlation between what she was witnessing and her own practice.

Article Title: Polly Braden spent two years documenting life for the women forced to leave Ukraine
Sentence: “I’d made this body of work about single parents (‘Holding the Baby,’ 2022), and seeing these women leaving Ukraine, I thought about everything they were going to have to do to support the children and older people they were bringing with them,” she told CNN in an interview.

Article Title: Polly Braden spent two years documenting life for the women forced to leave Ukraine
Sentence: Lena telling her mum she was offered a job.

Article Title: Polly Braden spent two years documenting life for the women forced to leave Ukraine
Sentence:
Courtesy Polly Braden

Weeks after those initial reportage images began being shown, Braden flew to Moldova, which shares a border with Ukraine, inspired to work on a new series.

Article Title: Polly Braden spent two years documenting life for the women forced to leave Ukraine
Sentence: “It felt important to record what was going to happen to these women.

Article Title: Polly Braden spent two years documenting life for the women forced to leave Ukraine
Sentence: They were going to have to find housing, schooling, jobs… to build new lives,” she explained.

Article Title: Polly Braden spent two years documenting life for the women forced to leave Ukraine
Sentence: “It also meant they suddenly became refugees — they might have been teachers, lawyers, important people in their community — what was that going to look like for them?”

Article Title: Polly Braden spent two years documenting life for the women forced to leave Ukraine
Sentence: The project would ultimately become an exhibition called “Leaving Ukraine,” currently on display at the Foundling Museum in London.

Article Title: Polly Braden spent two years documenting life for the women forced to leave Ukraine
Sentence: “Of course, it’s important we have pictures of the frontline and what’s happening inside Ukraine, but it’s also important we understand what role women play in war, especially this war, where women have given up their status in their country,” continued Braden, reflecting on the traditionally gendered approach to documenting conflict.

Article Title: Polly Braden spent two years documenting life for the women forced to leave Ukraine
Sentence:
“They are safeguarding the next generation of Ukraine.”

Anya with baby Vavara — seen here at 10 hours old — at the Inflancka No6 Women’s Hospital in Warsaw on May 16, 2022.

Article Title: Polly Braden spent two years documenting life for the women forced to leave Ukraine
Sentence:
Courtesy Polly Braden

Spanning two years (the most recent image was taken in early March 2024) and featuring a mix of still photography and moving image, “Leaving Ukraine” closely follows the stories of six women Braden met when she travelled to Moldova: law graduate Lena, pregnant mother Anya, school friends Sofiia, Aliesia and Yuliia, and Narine who left Ukraine with her children and a close friend.

Article Title: Polly Braden spent two years documenting life for the women forced to leave Ukraine
Sentence: Conscious of the work’s broader scope, Braden considers “Leaving Ukraine” not just a depiction of these six women and their families, but also as a reflection of the countries they’ve ended up in, which include Italy, Poland and the UK.

Article Title: Polly Braden spent two years documenting life for the women forced to leave Ukraine
Sentence: According to the UNHCR’s most recent report, Moldova has received over 850,000 Ukrainian refugees and more than 120,000 third country nationals since February 22, 2022.

Article Title: Polly Braden spent two years documenting life for the women forced to leave Ukraine
Sentence: Of them, as of November 12, 2023, more than 113,000 have stayed on in the country.

Article Title: Polly Braden spent two years documenting life for the women forced to leave Ukraine
Sentence: Narine with her son Valentine, 9. Chişinău, Moldova, March 2022.

Article Title: Polly Braden spent two years documenting life for the women forced to leave Ukraine
Sentence:
Courtesy Polly Braden

“I thought I’d meet people in a country then follow them building a life there, but not one person I met has landed in a country, found their feet and made it work,” she shared.

Article Title: Polly Braden spent two years documenting life for the women forced to leave Ukraine
Sentence: “They’ve had to move because they can’t find work, there’s no housing, they can’t get their kid to school — or they’ve landed in the countryside in a country they’ve never been to.”

Article Title: Polly Braden spent two years documenting life for the women forced to leave Ukraine
Sentence: Braden describes the project as wholly collaborative, detailing her close work with the women to construct an intimate portrait of their new reality (photographing Anya, for example, just hours after she gave birth).

Article Title: Polly Braden spent two years documenting life for the women forced to leave Ukraine
Sentence: Many of the images are tender studies of private moments, shot in homes, social spaces and on public transport.

Article Title: Polly Braden spent two years documenting life for the women forced to leave Ukraine
Sentence: “They’ve been telling their own story really, I’ve just been holding a camera,” she said.

Article Title: Polly Braden spent two years documenting life for the women forced to leave Ukraine
Sentence: Yulia,16, in Byala, Bulgaria, the day before the family packed up to drive to Warsaw, June 2022.

Article Title: Polly Braden spent two years documenting life for the women forced to leave Ukraine
Sentence:
Courtesy Polly Braden

Lena, who Braden recalled had become irritated speaking to journalists in Moldova, later came to live with her in London.

Article Title: Polly Braden spent two years documenting life for the women forced to leave Ukraine
Sentence: The photographer noted how they didn’t take any photos during this period.

Article Title: Polly Braden spent two years documenting life for the women forced to leave Ukraine
Sentence: “I thought it was quite invasive,” she said, reflecting on the trust they’d developed.

Article Title: Polly Braden spent two years documenting life for the women forced to leave Ukraine
Sentence: “After all it’s a privilege, (this work).

Article Title: Polly Braden spent two years documenting life for the women forced to leave Ukraine
Sentence: And finding a new life is like a jigsaw, right?”

Article Title: Polly Braden spent two years documenting life for the women forced to leave Ukraine
Sentence: Lena has since moved out, meeting a partner and having a baby, and Braden is conscious of how the war has affected her family’s trajectory.

Article Title: Polly Braden spent two years documenting life for the women forced to leave Ukraine
Sentence: “The child hopefully will speak Ukrainian, but they’re an English family,” she said.

Article Title: Polly Braden spent two years documenting life for the women forced to leave Ukraine
Sentence: Elsewhere, with two teenagers of her own, the photographer has taken great pleasure in working with the three schoolgirls, one of whom is now studying film in Warsaw and used the project in her coursework.

Article Title: Polly Braden spent two years documenting life for the women forced to leave Ukraine
Sentence: “The most amazing part about following young people, like Sofiia, Aliesia and Yuliia, is they’re optimistic and full of the joys of life,” she said.

Article Title: Polly Braden spent two years documenting life for the women forced to leave Ukraine
Sentence:
“Wanting love and all the normal things young people want.”

Narine with her children Nicole (6) and Valentine (9).

Article Title: Polly Braden spent two years documenting life for the women forced to leave Ukraine
Sentence: The family were preparing to leave Regina Pacis, Moldova, with their friend Yuliia looking out for a minibus that will drive them to Italy.

Article Title: Polly Braden spent two years documenting life for the women forced to leave Ukraine
Sentence:
Courtesy Polly Braden

Initially, Braden had envisioned she’d be able to return to Ukraine with some of the women, but with the war now in its third year, that has not yet been possible.

Article Title: Polly Braden spent two years documenting life for the women forced to leave Ukraine
Sentence: Ultimately she determined that the series is about building a life away from home, and “finding new paths in Europe.”

Article Title: Polly Braden spent two years documenting life for the women forced to leave Ukraine
Sentence: Similarly, her commitment to just a small group of families, in tandem with her long-term approach, allowed her to harness greater power in her storytelling.

Article Title: Polly Braden spent two years documenting life for the women forced to leave Ukraine
Sentence: “If we don’t look at individual stories,” she clarified, “then big policies are made without understanding details.”

Article Title: Man finds ‘England’s largest’ gold nugget, despite metal detector failing
Sentence:
CNN —

A treasure hunter struggling with faulty equipment has unearthed a gold nugget believed to be the largest ever found in England.

Article Title: Man finds ‘England’s largest’ gold nugget, despite metal detector failing
Sentence: Richard Brock discovered the gold nugget, weighing 64.8 grams (2.3 ounces), in the country’s Shropshire Hills near the border with Wales, auction house Mullock Jones said Thursday.

Article Title: Man finds ‘England’s largest’ gold nugget, despite metal detector failing
Sentence: The nugget is around the size of a UK 50 pence coin.

Article Title: Man finds ‘England’s largest’ gold nugget, despite metal detector failing
Sentence: The find, nicknamed Hiro’s Nugget, has an estimated worth of between £30,000 ($38,000) and £40,000 ($50,700), according to Shropshire-based Mullock Jones, which is handling the sale.

Article Title: Man finds ‘England’s largest’ gold nugget, despite metal detector failing
Sentence: However, it almost seemed that luck had eluded Brock, whose equipment almost failed him on the day of the dig.

Article Title: Man finds ‘England’s largest’ gold nugget, despite metal detector failing
Sentence: When Brock arrived at the site in Shropshire in May, he discovered that his metal detector was faulty, according to a press release from Mullock Jones.

Article Title: Man finds ‘England’s largest’ gold nugget, despite metal detector failing
Sentence: As his hopes dimmed, he turned to a piece of older equipment.

Article Title: Man finds ‘England’s largest’ gold nugget, despite metal detector failing
Sentence: At first he found only a coin of little value, but within five minutes he made the shocking discovery, the auction house said.

Article Title: Man finds ‘England’s largest’ gold nugget, despite metal detector failing
Sentence: “It just goes to show that it doesn’t really matter what equipment you use, if you are walking over the find and are alert enough to what might be lurking underneath the soil, that makes all the difference,” Brock said in the release.

Article Title: Man finds ‘England’s largest’ gold nugget, despite metal detector failing
Sentence: The nugget is considered to be a “rare find,” auctioneer Ben Jones of Mullock Jones told CNN Thursday.

Article Title: Man finds ‘England’s largest’ gold nugget, despite metal detector failing
Sentence: How it made it to the dig site is a mystery.

Article Title: Man finds ‘England’s largest’ gold nugget, despite metal detector failing
Sentence: Parts of the Shropshire Hills were once under a prehistoric ocean, and pieces of coral are often unearthed there, according to the auction house.

Article Title: Man finds ‘England’s largest’ gold nugget, despite metal detector failing
Sentence: “The site does contain an old road/ railway line and has remnants of Welsh stone within,” auctioneer Jones said, adding: “So [there’s] a variety of possibilities of how it made it there.”

Article Title: Man finds ‘England’s largest’ gold nugget, despite metal detector failing
Sentence: The auction ends April 1.

Article Title: Man finds ‘England’s largest’ gold nugget, despite metal detector failing
Sentence: Although Hiro’s Nugget is believed to be the largest discovered so far in England, several previous finds in other parts of the United Kingdom dwarf it in size.

Article Title: Man finds ‘England’s largest’ gold nugget, despite metal detector failing
Sentence: The record holder is the 121.3-gram [4.3 ounces]

Article Title: Man finds ‘England’s largest’ gold nugget, despite metal detector failing
Sentence: Reunion Nugget, found in Scotland in 2019.

Article Title: Opinion: ISIS is making a comeback
Sentence: Editor’s Note: Peter Bergen is CNN’s national security analyst, a vice president at New America, a professor of practice at Arizona State University and the host of the Audible podcast “In the Room” also on Apple and Spotify.

Article Title: Opinion: ISIS is making a comeback
Sentence: He is the author of “The Rise and Fall of Osama bin Laden.”

Article Title: Opinion: ISIS is making a comeback
Sentence: The views expressed in this commentary are his own.

Article Title: Opinion: ISIS is making a comeback
Sentence: Read more opinion at CNN.

Article Title: Opinion: ISIS is making a comeback
Sentence:
CNN —

If ISIS was indeed responsible for the attack Friday at a Moscow-area concert venue that killed at least 133 people, it would suggest that, unfortunately, the terror group is making something of a comeback.

Article Title: Opinion: ISIS is making a comeback
Sentence: ISIS claimed responsibility for the attack; a US official told CNN the US has no reason to doubt it.

Article Title: Opinion: ISIS is making a comeback
Sentence: Back in its heyday of 2014 and 2015, ISIS had controlled territory in Iraq and Syria around the size of the United Kingdom and a population of millions of people.

Article Title: Opinion: ISIS is making a comeback
Sentence: During that period, the group also carried out a number of terrorist plots in Europe, including an attack in Paris that killed 130 people in 2015.

Article Title: Opinion: ISIS is making a comeback
Sentence: ISIS had also inspired terrorists in the US, including the gunman who killed 49 people at the Pulse nightclub in Orlando, Florida, in 2016 in what was then the most lethal terrorist attack in the US since 9/11.

Article Title: Opinion: ISIS is making a comeback
Sentence: But between 2017 and 2018, ISIS lost its so-called geographical “caliphate” in Iraq and Syria, and it has since devolved into a loosely allied group of ISIS affiliates in Africa and Asia with seemingly scant capabilities to carry out large-scale attacks elsewhere.

Article Title: Opinion: ISIS is making a comeback
Sentence: One of the most virulent affiliates is ISIS-K in Afghanistan, which killed 13 American service members and some 170 Afghan civilians at Kabul Airport as the Biden administration pulled all US troops from Afghanistan in August 2021.

Article Title: Opinion: ISIS is making a comeback
Sentence: Yet, the understanding at the time was that ISIS affiliates in Afghanistan and certain African countries like the Democratic Republic of Congo or Somalia were not capable of carrying out major international attacks.

Article Title: Opinion: ISIS is making a comeback
Sentence: But then came a large-scale terrorist attack in Iran in January that killed 84 people at a memorial service commemorating General Qasem Soleimani, one of the most powerful military leaders in Iran who had been killed by a US drone strike in 2020.

Article Title: Opinion: ISIS is making a comeback
Sentence: Through that attack, ISIS-K showed that the group, which is very anti-Shia, could target a hostile state like predominantly Shia Iran.

Article Title: Opinion: ISIS is making a comeback
Sentence: In March alone, a Russian state news agency said the country had thwarted multiple ISIS-related incidents, including a plan to attack a synagogue in Moscow.

Article Title: Opinion: ISIS is making a comeback
Sentence: The US embassy in Russia also said on March 7 that it was “monitoring reports that extremists have imminent plans to target large gatherings in Moscow,” including concerts.

Article Title: Opinion: ISIS is making a comeback
Sentence: According to a US National Security Council spokesperson, “The US Government also shared this information with Russian authorities in accordance with its longstanding ‘duty to warn’ policy.”

Article Title: Opinion: ISIS is making a comeback
Sentence:
But Russian President Vladimir Putin dismissed the US’ warning as “provocative,” saying, “These actions resemble outright blackmail and the intention to intimidate and destabilize our society.”

Taken together, the fact that Russian authorities had detected a number of ISIS-related plots earlier this month and that US authorities were warning of an attack at the same time indicates that there was an active terrorist threat in Moscow from ISIS that was known not only to the US but also to the Russians.

Article Title: Opinion: ISIS is making a comeback
Sentence: But Russian President Vladimir Putin linked the suspects in Friday’s attack to Ukraine during a five-minute address on Saturday.

Article Title: Opinion: ISIS is making a comeback
Sentence: State news agencies said that authorities arrested the four men suspected of attacking the Moscow-area concert venue while they were trying to cross the border into Ukraine, and that they “had relevant contacts on the Ukrainian side,” according to the FSB.

Article Title: Opinion: ISIS is making a comeback
Sentence: Ukraine has emphatically denied any role in the attack, and both Ukrainian and American officials expressed concerns that Putin’s comments may be used to justify an escalation in the ongoing war.

Article Title: Opinion: ISIS is making a comeback
Sentence: ISIS-K certainly has the capability and motive to attack Russia.

Article Title: Opinion: ISIS is making a comeback
Sentence: When it comes to motive, the Russian support for the Syrian dictator Bashar al-Assad, which helped him remain in power during the Syrian civil war, certainly comes to mind.

Article Title: Opinion: ISIS is making a comeback
Sentence: For ISIS, Assad is a mortal enemy, both because he is a member of a Shia sect and because he has systematically killed Sunnis in Syria.

Article Title: Opinion: ISIS is making a comeback
Sentence: Also, historically, Russia has brutally repressed Muslim minorities like the Chechens.

Article Title: Opinion: ISIS is making a comeback
Sentence: As for capability, the ISIS-K attack in Iran earlier this year demonstrated that the group could carry out a large-scale attack outside of its home base in Afghanistan.

Article Title: Opinion: ISIS is making a comeback
Sentence: What we do know is that Putin made a glaring mistake by denouncing the US’ warning.

Article Title: Opinion: ISIS is making a comeback
Sentence: And if ISIS-K did attack the concert hall, the Biden administration would have to ask itself some serious questions about whether the decision to pull all American troops out of Afghanistan allowed ISIS to regroup there with the capability to carry out large-scale attacks in other countries.

Article Title: Opinion: ISIS is making a comeback
Sentence: If that were the case, that would be a blow for the Biden administration.

Article Title: Opinion: As a cancer survivor, I feel for Kate Middleton
Sentence: Editor’s Note: Sara Stewart is a film and culture writer who lives in western Pennsylvania.

Article Title: Opinion: As a cancer survivor, I feel for Kate Middleton
Sentence: The views expressed here are her own.

Article Title: Opinion: As a cancer survivor, I feel for Kate Middleton
Sentence: View more opinion on CNN.

Article Title: Opinion: As a cancer survivor, I feel for Kate Middleton
Sentence:
CNN —

As news that Catherine, Princess of Wales had announced her cancer diagnosis dominated headlines Friday, I felt a deep and traumatic solidarity.

Article Title: Opinion: As a cancer survivor, I feel for Kate Middleton
Sentence: Recovering from major abdominal surgery — as Kate has been since January — is ghastly, and having to do it so you can be healthy enough for chemotherapy is a humbling one-two punch from the universe.

Article Title: Opinion: As a cancer survivor, I feel for Kate Middleton
Sentence: For Kate, that’s topped off by having to endure it all while the entire world chases you down like a fox on one of those hunts the royals are always throwing.

Article Title: Opinion: As a cancer survivor, I feel for Kate Middleton
Sentence:
Sara Stewart Todd Thompson

Kate has not yet disclosed specifically what kind of cancer she has.

Article Title: Opinion: As a cancer survivor, I feel for Kate Middleton
Sentence: An oncologist told Today.com that it could be colon, stomach, genital or urinary cancer.

Article Title: Opinion: As a cancer survivor, I feel for Kate Middleton
Sentence: We know that rates of colon cancer diagnoses in particular are going up alarmingly in younger populations.

Article Title: Opinion: As a cancer survivor, I feel for Kate Middleton
Sentence: I was 45 when I received my diagnosis of stage 3 colon cancer, and, like Kate, underwent major abdominal surgery followed by chemo.

Article Title: Opinion: As a cancer survivor, I feel for Kate Middleton
Sentence: I was told by countless doctors and nurses that they were seeing an upsetting uptick in younger patients like me.

Article Title: Opinion: As a cancer survivor, I feel for Kate Middleton
Sentence: One of the first things health care providers recommend to aid your recovery from surgery is reducing your stress.

Article Title: Opinion: As a cancer survivor, I feel for Kate Middleton
Sentence: I truly cannot imagine trying to deal with the indignities of post-surgical recovery — such as, in my case not being able to walk even a single block unassisted for weeks, or being incontinent when you used to be a normal healthy person — on top of the relentless scrutiny Kate’s been under since that unnecessary photoshopped image.

Article Title: Opinion: As a cancer survivor, I feel for Kate Middleton
Sentence: But I do know this: She is in a unique position to be a much-needed voice for people around the world dealing with cancer at a young age.

Article Title: Opinion: As a cancer survivor, I feel for Kate Middleton
Sentence: As a survivor of a gastrointestinal cancer, whose sufferers face much greater stigma than other types of cancer, I feel this most acutely.

Article Title: Opinion: As a cancer survivor, I feel for Kate Middleton
Sentence: Kate is someone with a global public profile whose voice can truly make a difference in, for example, advocating for younger people to get colonoscopies and other cancer screenings.

Article Title: Opinion: As a cancer survivor, I feel for Kate Middleton
Sentence: For the development of blood tests to detect gastrointestinal and other hard-to-detect cancers.

Article Title: Opinion: As a cancer survivor, I feel for Kate Middleton
Sentence: And for health care providers to get on board with more modern practices, like the study that just found it’s unnecessary for people to starve themselves on a liquid diet the day before a colonoscopy.

Article Title: Opinion: As a cancer survivor, I feel for Kate Middleton
Sentence: I just celebrated my five-year cancerversary, which is to say I’ve been cancer-free since I finished a course of chemotherapy in February 2019.

Article Title: Opinion: As a cancer survivor, I feel for Kate Middleton
Sentence: People ask me how I’m feeling now, and when I answer, I make sure to throw in details like “I’m definitely going to be advocating for more public restroom access from now on!”

Article Title: Opinion: As a cancer survivor, I feel for Kate Middleton
Sentence: and “My digestive system will never be the same, but I’m happy to be alive!”

Article Title: Opinion: As a cancer survivor, I feel for Kate Middleton
Sentence: Maybe this makes me a Debbie Downer, but I’m fine with risking that to call attention to the fact that colon cancer survivors are often dealing with a very different version of “healthy” than the world might prefer to think about.

Article Title: Opinion: As a cancer survivor, I feel for Kate Middleton
Sentence: Depending on the nature of her abdominal surgery, Kate might have been assigned a short-term or a permanent colostomy bag.

Article Title: Opinion: As a cancer survivor, I feel for Kate Middleton
Sentence: If she was lucky enough not to, she’s very likely dealing with all kinds of abdominal distress nonetheless.

Article Title: Opinion: As a cancer survivor, I feel for Kate Middleton
Sentence: And although I cannot stress enough that she owes absolutely nothing to the public while she goes through treatment, my fervent hope is that once she’s on the other side of it she’ll become a powerful voice advocating for more ways of early testing and destigmatization.

Article Title: Opinion: As a cancer survivor, I feel for Kate Middleton
Sentence: Having cancer is not elegant.

Article Title: Opinion: As a cancer survivor, I feel for Kate Middleton
Sentence: It is not sophisticated.

Article Title: Opinion: As a cancer survivor, I feel for Kate Middleton
Sentence: I’m sure it’s the kind of thing

Article Title: Opinion: As a cancer survivor, I feel for Kate Middleton
Sentence: the royal family would rather never, ever think about.

Article Title: Opinion: As a cancer survivor, I feel for Kate Middleton
Sentence: But it’s landed squarely in their midst regardless, so this is Kate’s chance to make a real difference in the health outcomes of countless people around the world.

Article Title: Opinion: As a cancer survivor, I feel for Kate Middleton
Sentence: Here’s to a speedy and minimally awful course of chemotherapy, Kate.

Article Title: Opinion: As a cancer survivor, I feel for Kate Middleton
Sentence: If you ever want to swap caustic bathroom humor with a fellow survivor, you’re always welcome to come sit next to me.

Article Title: Opinion: Trump’s image is on the line
Sentence: Editor’s Note: Sign up to get this weekly column as a newsletter.

Article Title: Opinion: Trump’s image is on the line
Sentence: We’re looking back at the strongest, smartest opinion takes of the week from CNN and other outlets.

Article Title: Opinion: Trump’s image is on the line
Sentence:
CNN —

In Charles Dickens’ 1850 novel “David Copperfield,” the perpetually indebted Mr. Micawber notes that all he can offer his young lodger is this advice: “Annual income twenty pounds, annual expenditure nineteen nineteen six, result happiness.”

Article Title: Opinion: Trump’s image is on the line
Sentence: By contrast, “Annual income twenty pounds, annual expenditure twenty pounds ought and six, result misery.”

Article Title: Opinion: Trump’s image is on the line
Sentence: In that case, “the blossom is blighted, the leaf is withered,” Micawber says, “and in short you are forever floored.”

Article Title: Opinion: Trump’s image is on the line
Sentence: Like Dickens’ own father who gave him the same advice in real life, Micawber is dragged off to debtors’ prison, but he never loses his optimism that “something will turn up.”

Article Title: Opinion: Trump’s image is on the line

Sentence: Those structures largely came apart elsewhere over the past few decades, but New Jersey Democratic leaders have retained their unique influence thanks in large part to “the line,” a shorthand for the prized ballot real estate controlled by county party officials, many of whom are themselves unelected.

Article Title: Pandas come in different shades, and scientists now understand why

Article Title: Pandas come in different shades, and scientists now understand why

Article Title: Pandas come in different shades, and scientists now understand why

Article Title: Pandas come in different shades, and scientists now understand why
