Article Title: Pandas come in different shades, and scientists now understand why
Sentence: The first brown panda known to science was a female named Dandan.

Article Title: Pandas come in different shades, and scientists now understand why
Sentence: A local ranger found the ailing bear in Foping County in Shaanxi province’s

Article Title: Pandas come in different shades, and scientists now understand why
Sentence: Qinling Mountains in March 1985.

Article Title: Pandas come in different shades, and scientists now understand why
Sentence: The panda was held in captivity until her death in 2000.

Article Title: Pandas come in different shades, and scientists now understand why
Sentence:
Since Dandan’s discovery decades ago, there have been 11 reported sightings documented through official news sources or personal accounts shared with the authors of this latest study that appeared in the journal PNAS on March 4.

“The recurring instances of brown pandas imply that this trait may be inheritable.

Article Title: Pandas come in different shades, and scientists now understand why
Sentence: However, to date, the genetic basis underlying the brown-and-white coat color remains unclear,” the authors wrote.

Article Title: Pandas come in different shades, and scientists now understand why
Sentence: Gaining a better understanding of the distinctive coloration could help inform efforts to breed brown-and-white pandas in captivity, said senior author Dr. Fuwen Wei, a professor of wildlife ecology and conservation biology at the Chinese Academy of Sciences’ Institute of Zoology in Beijing.

Article Title: Pandas come in different shades, and scientists now understand why
Sentence: The status of the giant panda as a species is vulnerable, according to the International Union for Conservation of Nature Red List of Threatened Species.

Article Title: Pandas come in different shades, and scientists now understand why
Sentence: A wild giant panda in China's Qinling Mountains stares at the camera in March 2016.

Article Title: Pandas come in different shades, and scientists now understand why
Sentence:
Xinhua/Shutterstock

A panda family tree

To understand what lies behind the trait, the researchers studied Qizai, a male brown panda rescued as a cub in 2009 from Foping National Nature Reserve in Hanzhong.

Article Title: Pandas come in different shades, and scientists now understand why
Sentence: He is currently the only brown panda in captivity.

Article Title: Pandas come in different shades, and scientists now understand why
Sentence: When compared under a microscope with hair samples from three black-and-white pandas, Qizai’s brownish fur had fewer and smaller melanosomes, tiny structures found in cells that are responsible for skin and hair pigment in mammals.

Article Title: Pandas come in different shades, and scientists now understand why
Sentence: What’s more, the melanosomes were more likely to be irregularly shaped, the study team found.

Article Title: Pandas come in different shades, and scientists now understand why
Sentence: The researchers then gathered genetic information about Qizai and pieced together his family tree.

Article Title: Pandas come in different shades, and scientists now understand why
Sentence: Fresh scat, or bear poop, gathered at the nature reserve revealed the identity of his wild mother, a black-and-white female panda that wears a tracking collar and is known as Niuniu.

Article Title: Pandas come in different shades, and scientists now understand why
Sentence: The researchers also identified Qizai’s son, a black-and-white panda born in captivity in 2020.

Article Title: Pandas come in different shades, and scientists now understand why
Sentence: (The study team later identified Qizai’s father, Xiyue, a wild but tracked black-and-white panda, by studying the genetics of a wider population of pandas.)

Article Title: Pandas come in different shades, and scientists now understand why
Sentence: The scientists studied the genetic information from Qizai’s family members and compared it with the genetic information from 12 black-and-white pandas from the Qinling Mountains and 17 black-and-white pandas from other regions in China using information taken from scat and blood samples.

Article Title: Pandas come in different shades, and scientists now understand why
Sentence: While none of Qizai’s immediate family members had brown fur, the researchers were able to show that his parents and son all had one copy of the recessive trait on a gene known as Bace2, while Qizai had two copies.

Article Title: Pandas come in different shades, and scientists now understand why
Sentence: An individual’s genes can carry recessive traits, such as blue eyes or red hair in humans, without appearing as a physical characteristic.

Article Title: Pandas come in different shades, and scientists now understand why
Sentence: Each parent must possess a copy of the genetic variant and pass it on in order for the trait to appear in the offspring, as is the case with Qizai.

Article Title: Pandas come in different shades, and scientists now understand why
Sentence:
Genetic analysis solves an enigma

Thanks to an analysis of a tissue sample stored for more than two decades in ethanol, the scientists also were able to sequence the genome of Dandan, the first known brown panda.

Article Title: Pandas come in different shades, and scientists now understand why
Sentence: Dandan had the same recessive trait, the researchers found.

Article Title: Pandas come in different shades, and scientists now understand why
Sentence: The scientists then conducted a wider analysis of 192 black-and-white giant pandas to verify the responsible gene as Bace2.

Article Title: Pandas come in different shades, and scientists now understand why
Sentence: The mutation causing the brown coats was only present in two pandas hailing from the Qinling Mountains in Shaanxi, not Sichuan province, where the majority of China’s giant pandas live.

Article Title: Pandas come in different shades, and scientists now understand why
Sentence: To confirm the findings, the scientists used the CRISPR-Cas9 gene-editing tool to delete the genetic sequence they had identified as causing the mutation in the Bace2 gene in 78 lab mice.

Article Title: Pandas come in different shades, and scientists now understand why
Sentence: The change reduced the number and size of melanosomes in the mice.

Article Title: Pandas come in different shades, and scientists now understand why
Sentence: “The coat color of knockout mice is light brown,” said Wei, who is also president at Jiangxi Agricultural University in Nanchang in China’s Jiangxi province.

Article Title: Pandas come in different shades, and scientists now understand why
Sentence: “It proves that this deletion has the potential to alter the coat color of a mouse, as the pigmentation pathway is relatively conserved (shared) among mammals.

Article Title: Pandas come in different shades, and scientists now understand why
Sentence:
Therefore, it is very likely that this mutation influences the coat color of a brown panda.”

Natural variation vs. inbreeding

It’s not clear what caused the genetic mutation.

Article Title: Pandas come in different shades, and scientists now understand why
Sentence: Wei said it must be linked to the specific environment of the Qinling Mountains, which has a different climate than Sichuan.

Article Title: Pandas come in different shades, and scientists now understand why
Sentence: The genetic mutation did not appear to be a result of inbreeding, as once suspected, he said.

Article Title: Pandas come in different shades, and scientists now understand why
Sentence: “It is more likely to be a result of natural variation rather than inbreeding.

Article Title: Pandas come in different shades, and scientists now understand why
Sentence: Our kinship analysis indicates that Qizai’s parents are not closely related,” Wei added.

Article Title: Pandas come in different shades, and scientists now understand why
Sentence: Tiejun Wang, an associate professor in the department of natural resources at the University of Twente in the Netherlands, said it was good news that the unique coloration did not appear to be the result of inbreeding.

Article Title: Pandas come in different shades, and scientists now understand why
Sentence: Wang, who has studied brown pandas, was not involved in the study.

Article Title: Pandas come in different shades, and scientists now understand why
Sentence: “For those who are concerned about this species, this is a positive development,” said Wang, who said he worked as a field ranger in the mountains for 10 years.

Article Title: Pandas come in different shades, and scientists now understand why
Sentence: Wang said he applauded the team “for their tremendous efforts in trying to shed light on this scientific question.”

Article Title: Ditch your air fryer and replace it with a countertop oven
Sentence: Sign up for CNN’s Eat, But Better: Mediterranean Style.

Article Title: Ditch your air fryer and replace it with a countertop oven
Sentence: Our eight-part guide shows you a delicious expert-backed eating lifestyle that will boost your health for life.

Article Title: Ditch your air fryer and replace it with a countertop oven
Sentence:
CNN —

My love affair with small appliances started at an early age.

Article Title: Ditch your air fryer and replace it with a countertop oven
Sentence: The Easy-Bake Oven was my first glimpse of what magic could come from a miniature box, leading to a few experiments with microwave cooking — think nachos and Rice Krispie Treat bowls—during my latchkey kid years.

Article Title: Ditch your air fryer and replace it with a countertop oven
Sentence: And the minute I got my own off-campus apartment in college, I invested in my very own toaster oven.

Article Title: Ditch your air fryer and replace it with a countertop oven
Sentence: Twenty-something years later, toaster oven technology has moved far beyond the analog dial and hot coils of my first model.

Article Title: Ditch your air fryer and replace it with a countertop oven
Sentence: But my small oven love remains strong, and it’s the most-used appliance in my daily life.

Article Title: Ditch your air fryer and replace it with a countertop oven
Sentence: The word “oven” is crucial in its name because it does everything my full-size conventional oven can do and more.

Article Title: Ditch your air fryer and replace it with a countertop oven
Sentence: In fact, it’s not just a toaster oven; it’s a countertop oven.

Article Title: Ditch your air fryer and replace it with a countertop oven
Sentence: If I had to choose to keep only one of my kitchen toys — the high-speed blender, the stand mixer, the compressor ice-cream maker, the multicooker — the countertop oven would likely come out on top.

Article Title: Ditch your air fryer and replace it with a countertop oven
Sentence: (OK, I admit it would be difficult to give up the stand mixer.)

Article Title: Ditch your air fryer and replace it with a countertop oven
Sentence: That’s how deep my commitment to my countertop oven reaches.

Article Title: Ditch your air fryer and replace it with a countertop oven
Sentence: Here’s why.

Article Title: Ditch your air fryer and replace it with a countertop oven
Sentence:
The toaster oven is the original multitasker

Instead of having multiple appliances crowding my countertop, the countertop oven does the work of many.

Article Title: Ditch your air fryer and replace it with a countertop oven
Sentence: It toasts bread and bagels, sure, but it also has the capability to do convection baking, air frying, dehydrating and dough proofing.

Article Title: Ditch your air fryer and replace it with a countertop oven
Sentence: Its broiler is spacious enough and functions so much more effectively than my oven’s broiler that I don’t even risk throwing out my back to shove sheet pans into the drawer underneath the full-size oven.

Article Title: Ditch your air fryer and replace it with a countertop oven
Sentence: (Who designed these bottom broiler drawers, anyway?)

Article Title: Ditch your air fryer and replace it with a countertop oven
Sentence: My countertop oven is also my secret weapon in the fight for better leftovers.

Article Title: Ditch your air fryer and replace it with a countertop oven
Sentence: When I create a monthly meal plan, I’m always planning to reheat half of what I’m cooking, so this is a crucial function.

Article Title: Ditch your air fryer and replace it with a countertop oven
Sentence: And because most dishes taste better when they’re not zapped in a microwave, I let my countertop oven restore my meals to their original crispy, bubbly texture.

Article Title: Ditch your air fryer and replace it with a countertop oven
Sentence: No more soggy cutlets or mushy pasta casseroles in this house!

Article Title: Ditch your air fryer and replace it with a countertop oven
Sentence: A countertop oven is

Article Title: Ditch your air fryer and replace it with a countertop oven
Sentence:
a quick fix

Yes, I understand that a countertop oven will never heat food as quickly as the one-minute express cook button on a microwave can.

Article Title: Ditch your air fryer and replace it with a countertop oven
Sentence: But I’ll argue that the taste trade-offs are worth it, and that you’ll still be heating food and cooking more quickly than you would in a large conventional oven.

Article Title: Ditch your air fryer and replace it with a countertop oven
Sentence: My countertop oven preheats to 450 degrees Fahrenheit (232 degrees Celsius) in five minutes (I’ve timed it), whereas my full-size oven takes 15 minutes to reach the same temperature.

Article Title: Ditch your air fryer and replace it with a countertop oven
Sentence: That’s a big difference — I can be done eating my leftover-but-perfectly-heated pizza in those 10 minutes!

Article Title: Ditch your air fryer and replace it with a countertop oven
Sentence: Moreover, the convection and air-fry functions on my countertop oven cook food more quickly and efficiently than conventional heat, since the convection method circulates hot air around the food for a more even heat distribution.

Article Title: Ditch your air fryer and replace it with a countertop oven
Sentence: I can shave at least five minutes off my baking and roasting times every time I make meals in my countertop oven.

Article Title: Ditch your air fryer and replace it with a countertop oven
Sentence: When the decades-old range in our kitchen finally went to the big scrap pile in the sky a few years ago, I refused to replace it with a high-end model.

Article Title: Ditch your air fryer and replace it with a countertop oven
Sentence: My top-of-the-line countertop oven cost half as much as the range we purchased, and I use it twice as often.

Article Title: Ditch your air fryer and replace it with a countertop oven
Sentence:
It’s a summer savior

I’ll never forget the process of testing my first cookbook, “Classic Snacks Made from Scratch,” during a sweltering New Jersey summer.

Article Title: Ditch your air fryer and replace it with a countertop oven
Sentence: It was July, and I was working on various recipes for homemade crackers, which meant keeping my oven on for hours — in a house without central air-conditioning.

Article Title: Ditch your air fryer and replace it with a countertop oven
Sentence: In between batches, I laid on my kitchen floor, sweating and crying, wondering why I was voluntarily putting myself through such torture.

Article Title: Ditch your air fryer and replace it with a countertop oven
Sentence: I still don’t have central air, but thankfully, I’m not regularly tasked with developing and testing multiple baked goods every day of the week.

Article Title: Ditch your air fryer and replace it with a countertop oven
Sentence: For everyday summer baking and roasting, however, I’ll use my countertop oven, which gives off much less heat than my full-size oven and cools down much more quickly once its cooking cycle is finished.

Article Title: Ditch your air fryer and replace it with a countertop oven
Sentence: If I want to bake some goodies that require my larger baking sheets or multiple sheet pans, I’ll simply bake on my grill.

Article Title: Ditch your air fryer and replace it with a countertop oven
Sentence: What to look for in a countertop oven

Article Title: Ditch your air fryer and replace it with a countertop oven
Sentence: So, I’ve convinced you to ditch all your other appliances and replace them with a countertop oven.

Article Title: Ditch your air fryer and replace it with a countertop oven
Sentence: Great!

Article Title: Ditch your air fryer and replace it with a countertop oven
Sentence:
But before you rush out to buy one, think about what oven best suits your cooking habits.

Choose a model that can fit your everyday cookware and bakeware.

Article Title: Ditch your air fryer and replace it with a countertop oven
Sentence: My countertop oven is deep and wide enough to fit a standard 9-by-13-inch (23-by-33-centimeter) casserole dish or sheet pan or a 10-inch (25-centimeter) round baking pan or cast-iron skillet.

Article Title: Ditch your air fryer and replace it with a countertop oven
Sentence: This means I can cook meals for up to six or eight people in one little appliance.

Article Title: Ditch your air fryer and replace it with a countertop oven
Sentence: Yes, choosing a smaller oven can be tempting when it comes to keeping your kitchen looking open and tidy.

Article Title: Ditch your air fryer and replace it with a countertop oven
Sentence: For the most versatility, however, I’d recommend going with the largest model that can comfortably fit the space you’re planning to use it in.

Article Title: Ditch your air fryer and replace it with a countertop oven
Sentence: Your foods need the air circulating around them in the oven to cook most efficiently, so having a space that’s too small to allow that won’t be doing you any favors.

Article Title: Ditch your air fryer and replace it with a countertop oven
Sentence: Consider what extra functions you’ll need.

Article Title: Ditch your air fryer and replace it with a countertop oven
Sentence: As I noted earlier, my countertop oven comes with a lot of bells and whistles — including a few functions I don’t even bother using.

Article Title: Ditch your air fryer and replace it with a countertop oven
Sentence: I’ve never tried the slow cook function, for instance, even though it’s there.

Article Title: Ditch your air fryer and replace it with a countertop oven
Sentence: Some models come with wi-fi functionality so you can control them via an app.

Article Title: Ditch your air fryer and replace it with a countertop oven
Sentence: Decide if these things are worth the money to you.

Article Title: Ditch your air fryer and replace it with a countertop oven
Sentence: Casey Barber is a food writer, artist and editor of the website Good Food Stories.

Article Title: ‘Dirty Dozen’ 2024 list of foods with most pesticides
Sentence: Sign up for CNN’s Eat, But Better: Mediterranean Style.

Article Title: ‘Dirty Dozen’ 2024 list of foods with most pesticides
Sentence: Our eight-part guide shows you a delicious expert-backed eating lifestyle that will boost your health for life.

Article Title: ‘Dirty Dozen’ 2024 list of foods with most pesticides
Sentence:
CNN —

Approximately 95% of nonorganic strawberries, leafy greens such as spinach and kale, collard and mustard greens, grapes, peaches and pears tested by the United States government contained detectable levels of pesticides, according to the 2024 Shopper’s Guide to Pesticides in Produce.

Nectarines, apples, bell and hot peppers, cherries, blueberries and green beans rounded out the list of the 12 most contaminated samples of produce.

Article Title: ‘Dirty Dozen’ 2024 list of foods with most pesticides
Sentence: It’s dubbed the “Dirty Dozen” by the Environmental Working Group, or EWG, an environmental and health advocacy organization that has produced the annual report since 2004.

Article Title: ‘Dirty Dozen’ 2024 list of foods with most pesticides
Sentence: Pesticides have been linked in studies to preterm births, congenital malformations such as neural tube defects, spontaneous abortions and an increase in genetic damage in humans.

Article Title: ‘Dirty Dozen’ 2024 list of foods with most pesticides
Sentence: Exposure to pesticides has also been associated with lower sperm concentrations, heart disease, cancer and other disorders.

Article Title: ‘Dirty Dozen’ 2024 list of foods with most pesticides
Sentence: Farmworkers who use or are exposed to pesticides are at highest risk, according to studies.

Article Title: ‘Dirty Dozen’ 2024 list of foods with most pesticides
Sentence: A 2022 meta-analysis found workers exposed to pesticides were nearly five times as likely to have DNA damage while a February study found children exposed at an early age showed poorer neurodevelopment from infancy to adolescence.

Article Title: ‘Dirty Dozen’ 2024 list of foods with most pesticides
Sentence: It’s not all bad news.

Article Title: ‘Dirty Dozen’ 2024 list of foods with most pesticides
Sentence: Avocados, sweet corn, pineapples, onions and papayas led the “Clean Fifteen” list of conventionally grown produce with the least amount of trace pesticides — nearly 65% of the fruits and veggies in that grouping had no detectable pesticide residues, according to the report released Wednesday.

Article Title: ‘Dirty Dozen’ 2024 list of foods with most pesticides
Sentence: Rounding out the “Clean Fifteen” were frozen sweet peas, asparagus, honeydew melons, kiwis, cabbage, watermelons, mushrooms, mangoes, sweet potatoes and carrots.

Article Title: ‘Dirty Dozen’ 2024 list of foods with most pesticides
Sentence: Crops which grow close to the ground, such as strawberries, spinach and other leafy greens are particularly subject to pests.

Article Title: ‘Dirty Dozen’ 2024 list of foods with most pesticides
Sentence:
Ekaterina Goncharova/Moment RF/Getty Images

Washed, peeled and scrubbed

Each year, a rotating list of domestic and imported produce is tested by US Department of Agriculture and US Food and Drug Administration.

Article Title: ‘Dirty Dozen’ 2024 list of foods with most pesticides
Sentence: Staffers at the USDA Pesticide Data Program wash, peel and scrub fruits and vegetables as consumers would, while workers at the FDA only brush dirt off the produce.

Article Title: ‘Dirty Dozen’ 2024 list of foods with most pesticides
Sentence: Then the fruits and vegetables are tested for more than 250 different pesticides and the results are posted online.

Article Title: ‘Dirty Dozen’ 2024 list of foods with most pesticides
Sentence: For 2024, EWG researchers examined testing data on 47,510 samples of 46 nonorganic fruits and vegetables, with the majority of testing from the USDA.

Article Title: ‘Dirty Dozen’ 2024 list of foods with most pesticides
Sentence: An analysis of that data found traces of 254 pesticides in all fruits and vegetables analyzed, with 209 of those chemicals on produce in the “Dirty Dozen” list.

Article Title: ‘Dirty Dozen’ 2024 list of foods with most pesticides
Sentence: “We find that what ends up on one list versus the other reflects how those fruits and vegetables are grown,” said Alexis Temkin, EWG’s senior toxicologist.

Article Title: ‘Dirty Dozen’ 2024 list of foods with most pesticides
Sentence: “Avocados, for example, aren’t pesticide intensive, while strawberries grow very close to the ground and have a lot of pests.”

Article Title: ‘Dirty Dozen’ 2024 list of foods with most pesticides
Sentence:
Report is unfair to farmers, critics say

About 70% of nonorganic produce tested by the USDA and FDA have pesticide levels within the legal limits allowed by the US Environmental Protection Agency, according to the EWG report.

Article Title: ‘Dirty Dozen’ 2024 list of foods with most pesticides
Sentence: That fact makes the report misleading, said Carl Winter, emeritus professor of cooperative extension at the University of California, Davis.

Article Title: ‘Dirty Dozen’ 2024 list of foods with most pesticides
Sentence: “The dose makes the poison, not its presence or its absence, and that dose determines the potential for harm.

Article Title: ‘Dirty Dozen’ 2024 list of foods with most pesticides
Sentence: In many cases you’d have to be exposed to a million times more than what we’re exposed to before you’d even see any effects,” said Winter, speaking on behalf of the Alliance on Food and Farming, which represents organic and conventional farmers.

Article Title: ‘Dirty Dozen’ 2024 list of foods with most pesticides
Sentence: She pointed to times when regulators allowed potentially dangerous chemicals, such as the pesticide DCPA, to remain on the market long after scientific research had raised concerns.

Article Title: ‘Dirty Dozen’ 2024 list of foods with most pesticides
Sentence: The herbicide was linked to thyroid concerns for years before the EPA told the public the chemical posed “significant risks to human health” in 2023.

Article Title: ‘Dirty Dozen’ 2024 list of foods with most pesticides
Sentence: Another example: chlorpyrifos, a pesticide linked to brain damage in children and fetuses.

Article Title: ‘Dirty Dozen’ 2024 list of foods with most pesticides
Sentence: The American Academy of Pediatrics joined EWG in 2017 protesting the EPA’s continued approval of the chemical.

Article Title: ‘Dirty Dozen’ 2024 list of foods with most pesticides
Sentence: In addition, pesticides banned by the government continue to show up on crops sold in the US, according to the EWG report.

Article Title: ‘Dirty Dozen’ 2024 list of foods with most pesticides
Sentence: “Green beans for example, continue to show traces of acephate, a toxic pesticide the EPA banned for use on green beans more than 10 years ago,” Temkin said.

Article Title: ‘Dirty Dozen’ 2024 list of foods with most pesticides
Sentence: “A lot of pesticides found on the ‘Dirty Dozen’ have also been banned in the European Union because of their harmful effects on human health.”

Article Title: ‘Dirty Dozen’ 2024 list of foods with most pesticides
Sentence:
Another concern from critics is that the “Dirty Dozen” list is insulting to multigenerational farmers who struggle to grow food for the nation and feed those same products to their own children, said Steve Clement, CEO of Pacific Northwest Tree Fruit

“When this report comes out it’s like getting stabbed a little bit because we’re working so hard to put out a nice healthy product, and the implication of the ‘Dirty Dozen’ list is that it is unhealthy,” Clement said.

Article Title: ‘Dirty Dozen’ 2024 list of foods with most pesticides
Sentence: “It’s like doing something kind for somebody and then having them turn around and call you some sort of monster.”

Article Title: ‘Dirty Dozen’ 2024 list of foods with most pesticides
Sentence: The report may scare people away from eating the fruits and vegetables they need, said Neil Nagata, whose family has grown organic and conventional strawberries in Oceanside, California, for decades.

Article Title: ‘Dirty Dozen’ 2024 list of foods with most pesticides
Sentence: “Every time the report comes out, or there’s a scare on imported strawberries, we see our sales drop off,” Nagata said.

Article Title: ‘Dirty Dozen’ 2024 list of foods with most pesticides
Sentence: “It’s not as if we’re doing something that is wrong or incorrect, we’re actually producing very healthy, safe food.

Article Title: ‘Dirty Dozen’ 2024 list of foods with most pesticides
Sentence: In fact, we actually live in the strawberry field and my father is 100 and my mom is 97, and they still eat strawberries.”

Article Title: ‘Dirty Dozen’ 2024 list of foods with most pesticides
Sentence: Some farmers feel the term "Dirty Dozen" is insulting, according to the Alliance on Food and Farming.

Article Title: ‘Dirty Dozen’ 2024 list of foods with most pesticides
Sentence:
kcline/iStockphoto/Getty Images

It is important that people eat lots of fruits and vegetables, even conventionally grown, said EWG’s Temkin.

Article Title: ‘Dirty Dozen’ 2024 list of foods with most pesticides
Sentence: “We always emphasize that,” she said.

Article Title: ‘Dirty Dozen’ 2024 list of foods with most pesticides
Sentence: “We want to enable consumers who wish to avoid as many pesticides as possible by opting for organic versions of the ‘Dirty Dozen,’ where pesticide levels will be lower, and then, if they wish, choose less expensive conventionally grown produce from the ‘Clean Fifteen.’

Article Title: ‘Dirty Dozen’ 2024 list of foods with most pesticides
Sentence:
”

Organic produce is not more nutritious, but studies have found that levels of pesticides in the urine of adults and children can drop up to 95% after a switch to an organic diet.

Article Title: ‘Dirty Dozen’ 2024 list of foods with most pesticides
Sentence:
Fungicide levels were high

For the first time, EWG analysts looked at reported levels of fungicides, one form of pesticide used to kill fungal diseases such as powdery mildew.

Article Title: ‘Dirty Dozen’ 2024 list of foods with most pesticides
Sentence: “Four out of five of the most frequently found pesticides on the ‘Dirty Dozen’ list were fungicides, and they were also found in particularly high concentrations,” Temkin said.

Article Title: ‘Dirty Dozen’ 2024 list of foods with most pesticides
Sentence: Two fungicides — fludioxonil and pyrimethanil — had the highest concentration on the “Dirty Dozen” list of any other pesticide, according to the report.

Article Title: ‘Dirty Dozen’ 2024 list of foods with most pesticides
Sentence: Fludioxonil was found on 90% of peaches and nearly 30% of all “Dirty Dozen” samples, according to the report.

Article Title: ‘Dirty Dozen’ 2024 list of foods with most pesticides
Sentence: Pyrimethanil was found on 65% of pear, 30% of apple, 27% of grape, 26% of strawberry and 24% of nectarine samples.

Article Title: ‘Dirty Dozen’ 2024 list of foods with most pesticides
Sentence: “Fungicides are often applied after harvest to keep produce mold-free on its way to market.

Article Title: ‘Dirty Dozen’ 2024 list of foods with most pesticides
Sentence: That’s likely why the concentrations were so high on some samples – higher than other pesticides applied earlier in the growing season,” Temkin said.

Article Title: ‘Dirty Dozen’ 2024 list of foods with most pesticides
Sentence: “The application of the fungicide is also closer to the time the produce is put on store shelves and consumers are eating them.”

Article Title: ‘Dirty Dozen’ 2024 list of foods with most pesticides
Sentence: Fludioxonil creates a waxy coating on the fruit or vegetable that studies find is difficult to wash away.

Article Title: ‘Dirty Dozen’ 2024 list of foods with most pesticides
Sentence: While the EPA finds fludioxonil safe at regulated levels, some studies have raised concerns that it might disrupt hormone and neurological systems.

Article Title: ‘Dirty Dozen’ 2024 list of foods with most pesticides
Sentence: Exposing breast cancer cells to fludioxonil in a petri dish found the fungicide increased cell production by 1.5%.

Article Title: ‘Dirty Dozen’ 2024 list of foods with most pesticides
Sentence: Pyrimethanil was classified as a “possible human carcinogen” by the EPA in 2004, but the agency determined in 2015 the chemical was “not likely to be carcinogenic to humans” at low doses.

Article Title: ‘Dirty Dozen’ 2024 list of foods with most pesticides
Sentence: Studies have shown it to be toxic to tree frogs and aquatic life, and it may disrupt thyroid levels in pregnant women living in agricultural areas.

Article Title: ‘Dirty Dozen’ 2024 list of foods with most pesticides
Sentence: In lab tests, pyrimethanil and fludioxonil were show to impact androgen activity — hormones that contribute to growth and reproduction in both men and women.

Article Title: ‘Dirty Dozen’ 2024 list of foods with most pesticides
Sentence:
Ways to reduce pesticides in your food

Cleaning fruits and vegetables before eating does reduce pesticide levels, but “no washing method is 100% effective for removing all pesticide residues,” according to the National Pesticide Information Center.

Article Title: ‘Dirty Dozen’ 2024 list of foods with most pesticides
Sentence: Starting with clean hands, wash and rub produce under running water instead of soaking to remove the most pesticide, the center recommends on its website.

Article Title: ‘Dirty Dozen’ 2024 list of foods with most pesticides
Sentence: Don’t use soap, detergent or a commercial soak or scrub, however, as they have not been proven to be any more effective, according to the FDA.

Article Title: ‘Dirty Dozen’ 2024 list of foods with most pesticides
Sentence: Dry the produce with a clean cloth or paper towel to further reduce bacteria that may be present.

Article Title: Kermitops: Newly identified fossil named for Kermit the Frog could help solve evolutionary puzzle
Sentence: Sign up for CNN’s Wonder Theory science newsletter.

Article Title: Kermitops: Newly identified fossil named for Kermit the Frog could help solve evolutionary puzzle
Sentence: Explore the universe with news on fascinating discoveries, scientific advancements and more.

Article Title: Kermitops: Newly identified fossil named for Kermit the Frog could help solve evolutionary puzzle
Sentence:
CNN —

Paleontologists with the Smithsonian National Museum of Natural History have discovered a previously unknown prehistoric species — a 270 million-year-old amphibian with wide eyes and a cartoonish grin — and its name is a nod to an iconic froggy celebrity.

Article Title: Kermitops: Newly identified fossil named for Kermit the Frog could help solve evolutionary puzzle
Sentence: Kermit the Frog meet Kermitops gratus, the most recent ancient amphibian to be identified after examination of a tiny fossilized skull that once sat unstudied in the Smithsonian fossil collection for 40 years, according to a paper published Thursday in the Zoological Journal of the Linnean Society.

Article Title: Kermitops: Newly identified fossil named for Kermit the Frog could help solve evolutionary puzzle
Sentence: Predating the dinosaurs, Kermitops is believed to have roamed the lower Clear Fork Formation of Texas during the Early Permian Epoch 298.9 million to 272.3 million years ago.

Article Title: Kermitops: Newly identified fossil named for Kermit the Frog could help solve evolutionary puzzle
Sentence: The skull of the ancient amphibian, measuring just over an inch (about 2.5 centimeters) long, features big oval eye sockets and — due to its slightly crushed state — a lopsided smile that researchers said reminded them of the Muppet icon.

Article Title: Kermitops: Newly identified fossil named for Kermit the Frog could help solve evolutionary puzzle
Sentence: The researchers believe the small opening at the tip of the critter's snout, the internarial fontanelle, held a mucus gland that would aid in catching insects.

Article Title: Kermitops: Newly identified fossil named for Kermit the Frog could help solve evolutionary puzzle
Sentence: The palpebral ossicles were small boney shingles embedded within the eyelid to protect the eye.

Article Title: Kermitops: Newly identified fossil named for Kermit the Frog could help solve evolutionary puzzle
Sentence:
Brittany M. Hance/Smithsonian/CNN

The discovery of the new amphibian species could provide some answers to how frogs and salamanders evolved to get their special characteristics today, the authors wrote in the paper.

Article Title: Kermitops: Newly identified fossil named for Kermit the Frog could help solve evolutionary puzzle
Sentence: “One thing that Kermitops really shows is that the origins of modern amphibians are a little more complex than some of the research has led on,” said study coauthor Arjan Mann, a postdoctoral paleontologist at the Smithsonian National Museum of Natural History.

Article Title: Kermitops: Newly identified fossil named for Kermit the Frog could help solve evolutionary puzzle
Sentence: “And that really means that people need to keep studying these things because just looking at museum collections, like this fossil, has the potential to change our ideas of evolutionary hypotheses of living lineages.”

Article Title: Kermitops: Newly identified fossil named for Kermit the Frog could help solve evolutionary puzzle
Sentence: Kermitops, not a frog

Article Title: Kermitops: Newly identified fossil named for Kermit the Frog could help solve evolutionary puzzle
Sentence: The fossil was first uncovered in 1984 by the late Nicholas Hotton III, a museum paleontologist who had excavated fossils from the Red Beds in Texas, an area known to be rich in Permian-age remains.

Article Title: Kermitops: Newly identified fossil named for Kermit the Frog could help solve evolutionary puzzle
Sentence: Researchers unearthed a large cache at the site, including the remains of ancient reptiles, amphibians and synapsids, the precursors to mammals.

Article Title: Kermitops: Newly identified fossil named for Kermit the Frog could help solve evolutionary puzzle
Sentence: The resulting collection included so many finds, paleontologists could not study a number of the specimens, including the newly named Kermitops.

Article Title: Kermitops: Newly identified fossil named for Kermit the Frog could help solve evolutionary puzzle
Sentence: That changed in 2021, when the skull caught the eye of Mann, a postdoctoral fellow at the time, who was sifting through the Texas collection to see whether any notable specimens had been overlooked.

Article Title: Kermitops: Newly identified fossil named for Kermit the Frog could help solve evolutionary puzzle
Sentence: Authors of the new paper, Calvin So (left) and Arjan Mann (right), named the prehistoric amphibian after Kermit the Frog.

Sentence:
James D. Tiller/James D. Loreto/Courtesy National Museum of Natural History Smithsonian

“Not only was (the skull) well-prepared by somebody, but it had features that distinguished it from anything else in the group that I’d ever seen,” Mann said.

Article Title: Kermitops: Newly identified fossil named for Kermit the Frog could help solve evolutionary puzzle
Sentence: In early 2023, Calvin So, lead author of the new paper and a doctoral student at George Washington University, began to study the skull for a doctoral paper.

Article Title: Kermitops: Newly identified fossil named for Kermit the Frog could help solve evolutionary puzzle
Sentence: Kermitops is not classified as a frog because the prehistoric amphibian does not share all the same traits and anatomy found in modern frogs, So said.

Article Title: Kermitops: Newly identified fossil named for Kermit the Frog could help solve evolutionary puzzle
Sentence: But the researchers determined the specimen is from the group temnospondyls, which are believed to be the most common ancestor of all lissamphibians — a category that includes frogs, salamanders and caecilians, Mann added.

Article Title: Kermitops: Newly identified fossil named for Kermit the Frog could help solve evolutionary puzzle
Sentence: The researchers noted several features that the ancient amphibian shares with its modern-day relatives, including a similar location for the eardrum at the back of the skull, a small opening between the nostrils that produces a sticky mucus to help frogs catch their prey, and even evidence of bicuspid, pedicellate teeth that are unique to amphibians and are found in most modern amphibian species.

Article Title: Kermitops: Newly identified fossil named for Kermit the Frog could help solve evolutionary puzzle
Sentence:
Features of the ancient amphibian

The presence of teeth and other modern features of this prehistoric species can help researchers to better understand the evolutionary transition amphibians went through to get their unique features, such as teeth, today.

Article Title: Kermitops: Newly identified fossil named for Kermit the Frog could help solve evolutionary puzzle
Sentence: A June 2021 study found that some species of frogs have lost and again evolved teeth several times throughout their lineages.

Article Title: Kermitops: Newly identified fossil named for Kermit the Frog could help solve evolutionary puzzle
Sentence: “This work is significant because it provides yet one more distinct early distant relative of our modern amphibians,” said David Blackburn, a coauthor of that 2021 study and a curator of amphibians and reptiles at the Florida Museum of Natural History at the University of Florida, via email.

Article Title: Kermitops: Newly identified fossil named for Kermit the Frog could help solve evolutionary puzzle
Sentence: “The last 20 to 30 years has seen many new species discovered and described of these distant relatives, and each discovery tends to reshape our knowledge of the evolutionary tree,” Blackburn added.

Article Title: Kermitops: Newly identified fossil named for Kermit the Frog could help solve evolutionary puzzle
Sentence: But Kermitops had many features distinct from its modern relatives.

Article Title: Kermitops: Newly identified fossil named for Kermit the Frog could help solve evolutionary puzzle
Sentence: The critter’s robust skull had additional bones and elements that have likely disappeared with evolution, and its elongated snout paired with a short region of the skull behind the eyes was unique to the species, most likely serving to aid in catching insects.

Article Title: Kermitops: Newly identified fossil named for Kermit the Frog could help solve evolutionary puzzle
Sentence: The fossil’s features, a mix of modern and prehistoric traits, reinforces previous suggestions that amphibians’ evolution was complex, said Marc Jones, a curator of fossil reptiles at the Natural History Museum London.

Article Title: Kermitops: Newly identified fossil named for Kermit the Frog could help solve evolutionary puzzle
Sentence: “It further adds to the diversity of Early Permian animals that are likely the evolutionary cousins of modern amphibians.

Article Title: Kermitops: Newly identified fossil named for Kermit the Frog could help solve evolutionary puzzle
Sentence: It highlights the need for more fossils from the Late Permian,” Jones said via email, adding he appreciated the amphibian’s name.

Article Title: Kermitops: Newly identified fossil named for Kermit the Frog could help solve evolutionary puzzle
Sentence: “It’s not a frog but then technically neither is Kermit.

Article Title: Kermitops: Newly identified fossil named for Kermit the Frog could help solve evolutionary puzzle
Sentence: He has five fingers and a lizard frill.”

Article Title: Kermitops: Newly identified fossil named for Kermit the Frog could help solve evolutionary puzzle
Sentence:
The preservation of small fossils

The early fossil record for lissamphibians is considered to be fragmentary, according to a news release from the Smithsonian Institution, and is largely due to the creatures’ small size and delicate bone composition, which make the fossils difficult to preserve and find later, So said.

Article Title: Kermitops: Newly identified fossil named for Kermit the Frog could help solve evolutionary puzzle
Sentence: “What we see today is but a small percentage of all the things that were living in Earth’s history,” So added.

Article Title: Kermitops: Newly identified fossil named for Kermit the Frog could help solve evolutionary puzzle
Sentence: “And one of the conditions that significantly improves fossil preservation is their size, because if it’s larger, it’s going to be more resistant to some of the erosional forces that we experience such as wind erosion and water erosion.”

Article Title: Kermitops: Newly identified fossil named for Kermit the Frog could help solve evolutionary puzzle
Sentence: What’s more, while prehistoric species are typically thought to be large, Kermitops could help to fill in the gap of amphibian evolution, explaining how some of today’s critters got their small size.

Article Title: Kermitops: Newly identified fossil named for Kermit the Frog could help solve evolutionary puzzle
Sentence: The skull of Kermitops is of similar size to the skull of another well-known Early Permian amphibian, Gerobatrachus, which had a head about an inch in length (2.5 centimeters).

Article Title: Kermitops: Newly identified fossil named for Kermit the Frog could help solve evolutionary puzzle
Sentence: But many frogs today have bodies shorter than that length, Blackburn said.

Article Title: Kermitops: Newly identified fossil named for Kermit the Frog could help solve evolutionary puzzle
Sentence: “You might wonder, ‘Were there really no very tiny vertebrates in the past, similar in size to miniature species today?’

Article Title: Kermitops: Newly identified fossil named for Kermit the Frog could help solve evolutionary puzzle
Sentence: My bet is that yes, they existed, but our ability to find them in the fossil record is very difficult,” Blackburn added.

Article Title: Kermitops: Newly identified fossil named for Kermit the Frog could help solve evolutionary puzzle
Sentence: So said they hoped the species’ name would draw attention to the notable discoveries that paleontologists make through studying museum collections of prehistoric fossils — including those less imposing than dinosaurs.

Article Title: Kermitops: Newly identified fossil named for Kermit the Frog could help solve evolutionary puzzle
Sentence: “We wanted to name it Kermitops because we wanted to bring attention to this unique fossil that’s really small, that most people would not notice if you were to put it next to a Tyrannosaurus in the gallery,” So said.

Article Title: Mount Toba: One of the largest eruptions in Earth’s history could have wiped out humans
Sentence:
CNN —

About 74,000 years ago, Sumatra’s Mount Toba experienced a super-eruption, one of the largest in Earth’s history, potentially kicking off a massive disruption in the world’s climate.

Article Title: Mount Toba: One of the largest eruptions in Earth’s history could have wiped out humans
Sentence: Some scientists have suspected a volcanic winter resulting from the eruption was a big enough shift to wipe out most early humans due to genetic evidence suggesting a steep drop in the human population.

Article Title: Mount Toba: One of the largest eruptions in Earth’s history could have wiped out humans
Sentence: But now a cutting-edge study on an archaeological site in northwest Ethiopia once occupied by early modern humans has added to a growing body of evidence that suggests the event might not have been so apocalyptic.

Article Title: Mount Toba: One of the largest eruptions in Earth’s history could have wiped out humans
Sentence: Instead, the new research found humans in that location, known as Shinfa-Metema 1, adapted to the arid conditions brought on by the volcanic eruption in a way that may have facilitated humanity’s pivotal migration out of Africa to the rest of the world.

Article Title: Mount Toba: One of the largest eruptions in Earth’s history could have wiped out humans
Sentence: Microscopic fragments of volcanic glass found alongside stone tools and animal remains in the same layer of sediment at the Shinfa-Metema 1 site, near Ethiopia’s Shinfa River, show humans were occupying the site before and after the volcano erupted more than 4,000 miles away.

Article Title: Mount Toba: One of the largest eruptions in Earth’s history could have wiped out humans
Sentence: “These fragments are less than the diameter of a human hair.

Article Title: Mount Toba: One of the largest eruptions in Earth’s history could have wiped out humans
Sentence: Even as tiny as (that) they are still big enough to analyze the chemistry and the trace elements,” said John Kappelman, a professor of anthropology and geological science at the University of Texas at Austin and lead author of the study, which published Wednesday in the journal Nature.

Article Title: Mount Toba: One of the largest eruptions in Earth’s history could have wiped out humans
Sentence: By piecing together clues from the fossils and artifacts found at the site, along with geological and molecular analysis, the team began to understand how the humans living there forged ahead despite the likely climate shift that the volcanic cataclysm triggered.

Article Title: Mount Toba: One of the largest eruptions in Earth’s history could have wiped out humans
Sentence: Excavations at the Shinfa-Metema 1 site have revealed that a population of humans survived the eruption of the Mount Toba supervolcano 74,000 years ago.

Article Title: Mount Toba: One of the largest eruptions in Earth’s history could have wiped out humans
Sentence:
John Kappelman and Marsha Miller

Catching fish

To understand the climate around the time of the eruption, Kappelman and his colleagues analyzed oxygen and carbon isotopes, variations of the same element, from ostrich eggshells and fossilized mammal teeth.

Article Title: Mount Toba: One of the largest eruptions in Earth’s history could have wiped out humans
Sentence: That work shed light on water intake and revealed the animals ate plants that were more likely to grow in drier conditions.

Article Title: Mount Toba: One of the largest eruptions in Earth’s history could have wiped out humans
Sentence: “The isotopes are incorporated in the hard tissues.

Article Title: Mount Toba: One of the largest eruptions in Earth’s history could have wiped out humans
Sentence: So for the mammals, we look at their teeth, the enamel of their teeth, but we also find it in the eggshell of the ostrich,” he said.

Article Title: Mount Toba: One of the largest eruptions in Earth’s history could have wiped out humans
Sentence: An analysis of the site’s flora and fauna also found an abundance of fish remains in the aftermath of the eruption.

Article Title: Mount Toba: One of the largest eruptions in Earth’s history could have wiped out humans
Sentence: The finding is perhaps not surprising given how near the site was to the river, but fish are rare in other Stone Age sites from the same period, the study noted.

Article Title: Mount Toba: One of the largest eruptions in Earth’s history could have wiped out humans
Sentence: “People start to increase the percentage of fish in the diet when Toba comes in.

Article Title: Mount Toba: One of the largest eruptions in Earth’s history could have wiped out humans
Sentence: They’re capturing and processing almost four times as much fish (as before the eruption),” he said.

Article Title: Mount Toba: One of the largest eruptions in Earth’s history could have wiped out humans
Sentence: “We think the reason for that is because if Toba is in fact, creating more aridity, that means it’s going to be a shorter wet season, which means longer dry season.”

Article Title: Mount Toba: One of the largest eruptions in Earth’s history could have wiped out humans
Sentence: The team theorized that the drier climate, counterintuitively, explains the increased reliance on fish:

Article Title: Mount Toba: One of the largest eruptions in Earth’s history could have wiped out humans
Sentence: As the river shrank, fish were trapped in water holes or shallower streams that hunters could more easily target.

Article Title: Mount Toba: One of the largest eruptions in Earth’s history could have wiped out humans
Sentence:
Blue vs. green corridor

The fish-rich water holes may have potentially created what the team described as a “blue corridor,” along which early humans moved north out of Africa once they were depleted of fish.

Article Title: Mount Toba: One of the largest eruptions in Earth’s history could have wiped out humans
Sentence: This theory contradicts most other models that suggest that humanity’s main migration out of Africa took place along “green corridors” during humid periods.

Article Title: Mount Toba: One of the largest eruptions in Earth’s history could have wiped out humans
Sentence: “This study … demonstrates the great plasticity of Homo sapiens populations and their ability to adapt easily to any type of environment, whether hyper-humid or hyper-arid, including during catastrophic events such as the hyper-explosion of the Toba volcano,” said Ludovic Slimak, a researcher at the French National Centre for Scientific Research and the University of Toulouse, in an email.

Article Title: Mount Toba: One of the largest eruptions in Earth’s history could have wiped out humans
Sentence: Slimak was not involved in the research.

Article Title: Mount Toba: One of the largest eruptions in Earth’s history could have wiped out humans
Sentence: The study authors were also able to explore the geology of the ancient riverbed, which suggested that it flowed slower and lower at that point than in the present.

Article Title: Mount Toba: One of the largest eruptions in Earth’s history could have wiped out humans
Sentence: “We can do that by just looking at the cobbles,” Kappelman said.

Article Title: Mount Toba: One of the largest eruptions in Earth’s history could have wiped out humans
Sentence: “A very energetic river can move bigger boulders and cobbles than a river that isn’t that (energetic.)

Article Title: Mount Toba: One of the largest eruptions in Earth’s history could have wiped out humans
Sentence: What (cobbles) we find for the ancestor river are smaller than the river today.

Article Title: Mount Toba: One of the largest eruptions in Earth’s history could have wiped out humans
Sentence: The excavation team was able to build a detailed picture of what happened at the site in Ethiopia around 74,000 years ago.

Article Title: Mount Toba: One of the largest eruptions in Earth’s history could have wiped out humans
Sentence:
Lawrence C. Todd

Oldest known arrowheads?

Article Title: Mount Toba: One of the largest eruptions in Earth’s history could have wiped out humans
Sentence: The researchers also uncovered the remains of several small triangular points, which tantalizingly rank among the earliest examples of the use of archery and provide clues that the site’s inhabitants might have used bows and arrows to hunt fish and other larger prey.

Article Title: Mount Toba: One of the largest eruptions in Earth’s history could have wiped out humans
Sentence: Slimak, who has studied similar points discovered in France that date back 50,000 years, agreed with the new study’s assessment of the artifacts.

Article Title: Mount Toba: One of the largest eruptions in Earth’s history could have wiped out humans
Sentence: “The authors also highlight very clear indicators suggesting the existence of archery here 74,000 years ago,” Slimak said.

Article Title: Mount Toba: One of the largest eruptions in Earth’s history could have wiped out humans
Sentence: “There is therefore every reason to … consider these ancient Homo sapiens as bearers of already highly advanced technologies, largely emancipated from natural and climatic constraints, crucial factors for understanding their migrations later on, across all continents and under all latitudes.”

Article Title: Mount Toba: One of the largest eruptions in Earth’s history could have wiped out humans
Sentence: Ancient species of humans likely left Africa multiple times, but archaeologists and geneticists largely agree that the most significant dispersal of Homo sapiens, our own species — which ultimately led to modern humans living in every corner of the globe — took place around 70,000 to 50,000 years ago.

Article Title: Mount Toba: One of the largest eruptions in Earth’s history could have wiped out humans
Sentence: The new research offers another potential scenario for how this dispersal happened while not ruling out previous theories, said Chris Stringer, a professor and research leader in human evolution at the Natural History Museum in London, who called it an “intriguing paper.”

Article Title: Mount Toba: One of the largest eruptions in Earth’s history could have wiped out humans
Sentence: “I’m sure each of these propositions will fuel debate amongst the relevant specialists but I think the authors have made a plausible (though not definitive) case for each scenario they propose,” Stringer said via email.

Article Title: Mount Toba: One of the largest eruptions in Earth’s history could have wiped out humans
Sentence: “Of course this new work doesn’t mean that humid corridors were not still important conduits for dispersals out of Africa, but this work adds credible additional possibilities during more arid phases.”

Article Title: Judge tosses DOJ suit against social media influencers in alleged pump-and-dump scheme
Sentence:
CNN —

A federal judge has dismissed a criminal indictment against seven Twitter users and a podcaster accused of running a $100 million stock manipulation scheme over social media.

Article Title: Judge tosses DOJ suit against social media influencers in alleged pump-and-dump scheme
Sentence: The Justice Department did not do enough to describe the influencers’ activities as a “scheme to defraud,” wrote District Judge Andrew Hanen of the US District Court for the Southern District of Texas, in an order dated Wednesday.

Article Title: Judge tosses DOJ suit against social media influencers in alleged pump-and-dump scheme
Sentence: In the indictment, the DOJ had alleged a lucrative “pump and dump” scheme in which the social media influencers used the messaging app Discord to promote certain stocks to their followers before selling their positions after a run-up in the stocks’ prices.

Article Title: Judge tosses DOJ suit against social media influencers in alleged pump-and-dump scheme
Sentence: The result was an alleged conspiracy by defendants “to unlawfully enrich themselves by pumping and dumping securities … through false and misleading posts and material omissions on Twitter [and Discord].”

Article Title: Judge tosses DOJ suit against social media influencers in alleged pump-and-dump scheme
Sentence: At least one of the defendants whose account CNN previously reviewed had tweeted about Gamestop and AMC, two so-called “meme stocks” that saw significant public interest and trading in 2021.

Article Title: Judge tosses DOJ suit against social media influencers in alleged pump-and-dump scheme
Sentence: On Wednesday, however, Hanen wrote that while the defendants may well have intended to separate followers from their money, the evidence did not support a finding of actual securities fraud or conspiracy to commit fraud.

Article Title: Judge tosses DOJ suit against social media influencers in alleged pump-and-dump scheme
Sentence: “The key question is whether one statement by one of the co-defendants that ‘we’re robbing … idiots of their money,’ which is alleged in the Indictment, is sufficient,” the judge wrote.

Article Title: Judge tosses DOJ suit against social media influencers in alleged pump-and-dump scheme
Sentence: “This statement sufficiently alleges ‘intent to defraud’ … but does not on its own sufficiently allege that Defendants executed, or conspired to execute, a ‘scheme to defraud’ investors of money or property” as defined by court precedent.

Article Title: Judge tosses DOJ suit against social media influencers in alleged pump-and-dump scheme
Sentence: Unlike a traditional fraud case, Hanen added, the DOJ merely claimed investors were deprived of relevant market information — not that the influencers directly stole money from investors.
